Reviews.Title: “Florida Vacation, I would go back, but shop around first”
Reviews.Author: gib_nod
Reviews.Content: Nice place, near disney, Lots of restaurants near bye. Stayed in a 3 bedroom 3 bath. Rooms are big nice and clean, but starting to show their age a little. The Kitchen was great and well equipped. The staff was excellent, we had one problem with the dryer and was quickly repaired. The rooms overlooking the lake have a better view and can see the fireworks from Disney at night! I would stay away from the rooms facing the parking lot. The distances from Universal and Seaworld is over 30 minutes. Shuttle for Disney only and is great. Save the parking headache and gets you back quick. If your going to Universal or Seaworld ask for a price on the shuttle, it may be worth you while as they have negotiated rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy with this place”
Reviews.Author: Colonel_Klink_10
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was talking with Cari at All Star Vacations when I booked my room. We went over everything twice I was told I would have a beautiful lake view. I informed Cari that our party of 6 included my 70+ yr old Parents. First issue we noticed upon arrival is that this resort is kind of hidden and not to many places around it however shopping and dining are within a few miles or a little more depending on what your looking for. As far as our beautiful lake view, well, that turned out to be a corner unit with one view of the pool and another view of trees. I hardly had any view of the so called lake. Next issue, the lack of towels for 6 people staying for 8 days also the bare minimum of cooking pots and pans again for 6 people. Next issue, master bathroom had mold around the entire shower area.All this was discussed at time of booking and I was assured that "you will not have any problems here at all " . Next issue, 3 of those nights we had someone above us banging, clanking and running what sounded like a vacuum cleaner in the middle of the night sometimes at 2am. I had to call security about the constant noise level above us. I must say that most of the issues with towels and pots & pans and the mold they took care of pretty quick. One of our toilets was flushing really slow and plugging from just a few squares of toilet paper, maintenance had to come a few times to correct problem.On our last day the pool was closed for some issue that we had no clue what it was. The game room is a joke, there are about 3-4 arcade game that are outdated and work intermittently. The 2 billiard tables are another joke, the Que balls have huge chunks missing from them. All Star Vacations refund us $260 for our troubles. We feel they could have refunded us more for our troubles but during the middle of the week Cari gave me an ultimatum to pack up and leave that day with a full refund or shut up and enjoy all the crap we misled you to stay here. When I'm paying a premium price and I'm told wonderful things about the property and their not up to the expectations I was led to believe, well I think anyone else would also be unhappy about that. If you do decide to stay here, make sure you go over everything or get it in writing and make sure you get the very top floor if you don't want any noise issues from above. The good about this place is that the condo was pretty clean and service was pretty good for problems. They did offer to move us into a smaller condo with one less bed for the lake view but we needed that extra bed for us. I would recommend other places before I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Returning in June!!!”
Reviews.Author: humblebee4
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to return June 15-19, 2012. The first time my family and I stayed here was May 2009 in a four bedroom condo apartment, and we do not have the desire to stay anywhere else . The condo apartments at Lighhouse are top notch, and I have not found another place that can compare to this resort. I love the mixed drinks at the outdoor bar/pub, and I look forward to spending more time in one of the pools during this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JulieinOntario
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here, second year now. Very clean, quiet, and huge beautiful condo suite. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Almost scared to tell everyone how great it is!”
Reviews.Author: WeHeartVacas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Lighthouse Key Resort 3 times in the last 4 years, and we're scheduled to go back in May. I am so glad we found this place. I am possibly the pickiest person about where I lay my head on vacations, and I rarely stay at the same place twice. These condos are beautiful and super convenient. The decorating is so pretty, and not all outdated like a lot of other vacation homes that you get when you need a full kitchen and laundry room. The countertops in the bathroom and kitchen are granite and the fixtures are all very nice. It's super clean. I've read reviews about bad housekeeping and ant problems but we have never experienced anything negative at all. There is no daily housekeeping but you get a free mid-week stay if you stay 6 nights. But there are plenty towels and soap and such to last a week. And since there's a washer/dryer, it's not a problem to wash a load if you need to. The pool is HUGE and never crowded. We've never been there and seen more than 2 people besides us. This is why it's great that it's a "small" resort with only 2 buildings, 5 floors each. It's very close to Disney and there are shuttles provided if you want that. We always just drive since it's so close so we can come and go as we please from the parks. Even when we don't go to Disney, we love to stay here. There are restaurants close by and it's not far from any of the main attractions. And you can't beat the price. I will keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Nathan B
Reviews.Content: We had 8 night here in January for a family vacation. Traveling with a 6yr old, 20month baby parents and mother in law we needed space and the lighthouse was perfect. We had a 4bedroom apartment and it was brilliant. Wifi was great, kitchen facilities perfect, and could not fault the room at all. Staff are a little inconsistent in service but overall not a big problem. Great to have shuttle service to parks and drivers were very good giving plenty of tips and being very flexible on returning back to hotel. We would definitely return to Lighthouse Key and highly recommend it for families wanting plenty of space

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous two week stay in Building 2 - 304! The condo was very large and with three children that is a must! The fully stocked kitchen is huge and I had a great view of the lake from from the kitchen and all bedrooms. The kids loved and we could watch the Disney and Epcot fireworks from our lanai every night. It was so easy to get to the parks, you don't want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path residential hotel near Disney”
Reviews.Author: lanzmo
Reviews.Content: We had a three bedroom unit. Room 1303. It was GREAT! There are two master suites and a bedroom with two twin beds for our two boys. The kitchen is great as is the living area. If you want a residential unit about 5 miles from the Magic Kingdom you should consider this property.

Reviews.Title: “No customer service”
Reviews.Author: Gordon B
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days in a four bedroom condo with 8 people and although the room was nice and spacious, cleaning of the room was average with used tissues and band aids lying around and stains on some of the sheets. Worst of all on our midweek clean our iPad was stolen from our room. This is the part that was really annoying, staff, especially management were not compassionate at all and did not seem to care that something was stolen from our room. Would not recommend this resort at alldue to the lack of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, good location, average service.”
Reviews.Author: IanB1965
Reviews.Content: Spent 12 nights here in January on a family holiday with the teenagers. The apartments are big, clean and well appointed. We didn't spend much time in at as we were always at the parks. Quiet, good size rooms, with a full laundry and kitchen. Other facilities at the resort were good. The location is good with no park more than 15 minutes and most 10 minutes. Price is great compared to staying at the parks and more than paid for the hire car. There is a shuttle too but it gets you to the parks a bit late. Only negative was the service. In particular it took us about 4 days to get shower heads fixed that were calcified. They just didn't follow through and hand offs were poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, wonderful condo”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy S
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip, everything was so clean upon arrival, staff were friendly. The theme parks are all within a 20 minute drive, there are drug stores and a great grocery store less than a mile from the resort. We had an awesome time and would definitely come back. For the price, it can't be beat, hands down. Disney can't touch this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: cards213
Reviews.Content: Just returned from trip to Orlando/Kissimmee and had a wonderful stay at Lighthouse Key. Given the time of year, we pretty much had the pool, jacuzzi, workout room and theater to ourselves. Mix of older people and parents with families but not many. Felt very safe there too as it is gated. There is a Publix and Target nearby for groceries. Used the complimentary shuttle for trip to Magic Kingdom and driver was friendly, professional, and on time (both ways) Condo was well equipped and clean!! Will recommend Lighthouse Key to friends/family and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not luxurious, but just clean enough”
Reviews.Author: pattismith999
Reviews.Content: Booked here very last minute on a whim during holiday time (right before new years and thru new years) solely due to good reviews on trip advisor. This trip was a splurge, so I was trying to save $. I got anxious after booking it because the pool looked super small and I found a sister resort of theirs that had a water park, but this was uncancellable at that time. Also it was more than I wanted to spend ($259/night but it was a 2 bedroom condo with 2 bathrooms) and I think you can search for owner-done rentals and get a cheaper rate. But, the reservation wasn't changeable after that. I should note that I am used to staying in 4 and 5 star resorts. They did let us check in an hour before our check in time, because the room was ready, and that was nice. The front desk people were nice. The condo was clean when we checked in. Elevators were very slow, we were on the second floor. The carpets had some stains near the dining table and that was gross. There were fake flower arrangements and a few of them had chipped ceramic pots. The rooms could definitely use touching up in terms of paint and everything - it was showing its age and the decor looked like it was issued the same for every room and needed updating. The first bedroom was SUPER TINY and had glass block windows that didn't open, the windows were connected to the hallway and it was very noisy there - and there were numerous loud guests who yelled from the hallway. It freaked us out that the windows didn't open and that room was very stuffy. It had a twin size trundle bed. This room would NOT be good for adults. The other bedroom was further in and had a king size bed and seemed clean enough. The toilet closet for the master bedroom was creepy with horribly depressing lighting so we all avoided this toilet. The master shower (which we all ended up using for no particular reason except that it was a stall shower and easier to use vs. the other bathroom which had a bathtub shower) had mold buildup around the door which grossed me out. The water pressure was HORRIBLE and I called to see if they could come adjust the showerhead to make the water pressure stronger, they said they would send maintenance, but they never sent anyone or called us to say they couldn't send anyone. The master bathroom also had a jacuzzi tub, which we were excited about. Well we used it just once, and after that there was no hot water for the 3 showers afterwards, so we all had freezing cold showers...not fun....ridiculous. The kitchen was well equipped and nice with granite counters and great storage space. The fridge and freezer were clean. The condo is well located with huge supermarkets nearby. The balcony had just enough room for a table and chairs and a side view of the fake pond. The washer and dryer were REALLY OLD and made SO MUCH NOISE when using them, we couldn't believe it. The dryer would keep going and never stop until you stopped it, there was no automatic turnoff which was odd. It was cold for us at night and we asked for extra blankets, which they brought, but they were very thin cotton blankets which didn't do much of anything. The "resort" ended up being jam packed and it was impossible to find parking right near the building, we just had to walk a little more. There is a deli with some foods and they will deliver to your room and the guy was super friendly. We called and got a burger with onion rings that was ok, but the grilled chicken wrap was inedible and we threw it out. We also got fried mushrooms and mozz sticks which were gross. When I finally visited the deli I was surprised at how sparse the offerings were and it was depressing in there - I bought some microwave popcorn, a beer and some gum. There were some dvds for rent but they were all pretty old. The deli people were nice. We didn't get to swim in the pool but there were some families enjoying it and it seemed fine. We were just too busy during the day and then tired when we got back to the room. There's another resort right before Lighthouse Key on the same side and it's the Holiday Inn Vacation Club or something like that. It looked really nice but the reviews sound like there's a lot of pressure to see the presentations, which is a huge turnoff. All in all, I guess I would return here if we were kind of desperate...the best thing is that there was a lot of space in the common area. But I'd like a place with a bigger pool, maybe a jacuzzi, and real room service. It kind of felt like a sub par place to stay but was just good enough for us not to feel yucky or trashy. I read enough reviews to know not to trust the free shuttle service - sounds like a complete nightmare - I did book a brand new car through Enterprise through the hotel's website, for only $35/day which was the cheapest price I could find. I definitely recommend getting your own car because you will end up spending more on cabs/getting frustrated and wasting tons of time.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for economy price”
Reviews.Author: Pink_bear19
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family here in January 2012 for a few days and loved it. Even the great photos on the website didn't prepare us for the luxury of the actual condo once we checked in. We had a 3 bedroom/3 bathroom condo and it was huge with everything you could need. Kitchen was fully equipped with large fridge and the convenience of washer/dryer in our apartment was great. We also all managed to successfully connect to wifi without any issues. The only complaint (and it doesn't actually relate to the accommodation) is the free shuttle service to Disney. Our shuttle going out was 25 minutes late and, despite having booked, we had to call and check when we came home as he was 20 minutes late (and we weren't sure he was actually coming). He then took a large detour as he drops off at other hotels quite a way apart so it took us ages to get home. Add to this the fact that the shuttle times aren't that convenient - I think it would have been easier to drive ourselves or get a cab. Overall - couldn't fault the accommodation, facilities and staff and would definitely recommend this place to others. Location is great, lots of food choices nearby and really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly602
Reviews.Content: I am actually still at this resort om our last day of vacation. I've never written a review before but honestly felt I had to because I've been so happy with our choice to stay here. We are in a 4 BR/ 3 BA and have 7 adults and 2 children staying very comfortably there. The location is absolutely perfect and SO much less expensive than staying on the Disney grounds. We did Disney one day, Harry Potter World the next, and then Sea World yesterday and it took 10 min or less to get to each. The resort itself is amazing - excellent food at the Beacon Deli, large heated pool for kids, hot tub, and even a movie theatre! It has been the perfect home base for our vacation and I'm so grateful to have found it. If you're looking for a great place for your Disney/Orlando vacation- choose the Lighthouse!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret, Very Luxorious”
Reviews.Author: betsyhcna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the second week of december and just fell in love with the place. I had done alot of research and finally choose this hotel, and we were beyond pleased. We rented a 4 bedroom 3 bath condo that was in immaculate condition top to bottom. We made much use of the large kitchen and washer and dryer in the unit. Beds were comfortable and temp in the rooms was great. Amazing location, close to disney and right by lots of shops and restruants. All we needed was right on the same road as the hotel. We were in building one close to the pool, which we used quiet often. The deli, was dissapointing the food was gross but we ordered from there once and learned our lesson. The Bar was nice and had great prices. We used the gym daily to run and it had a beatiful veiw of the pool. The lounge was decorated for christmas and the movie theater was very clean. However, be aware that internet does not work well, but the business center has internet that works very well.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic week at Lighthouse Key. What a place!”
Reviews.Author: DonTheDIYer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Building 2, unit 6-2002 LK-LK #304 - very quiet and had a great view of the lake. It was really rejuvenating to sit and have a coffee on the lanai in the morning and feel the sun as it came up over the horizon. (Being from the north, I knew all too well that I would be enduring much colder days before I would be back again). While sitting there, I would have unexpected company – a bird, something like a cormorant, would perch out on a tree at the water’s edge. I think he or she was fishing, or else surveying her/his domain. Either way, because of the demeanor, I nicknamed him/her ‘the Lightkeeper’. Watching The Lightkeeper was very therapeutic as I soaked it all in. In the evening, you could see the Disney fireworks and I caught the most amazing heat lightning display I have ever seen. The electricity was dancing in the sky – unbelievable. Hit the deli, the pool, the poolside bar and the games room for some pool (billiards). All were top notch, although my billiards skills needs some work! Managed to get some golf in at the courses located just across the lake from the resort. The folks at the front desk arranged everything, including discounts. Everyone at the resort was very helpful and courteous. Had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “great for the $$”
Reviews.Author: brad843
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I took our annual Disney trip labor day weekend and stayed at Lighthouse Key. This was the first time in 5 years that we had not stayed at a Disney resort but for the price we thought we would give it a shot. The place was great for the price, we had a 3 bedroom unit that overlooked the lake. Driving to the parks wasnt bad, only took about 10 mins to get to each park. Overall, i think the major downfall compared to staying at Disney is the shuttle, but if your looking to save some money this place is a great stay. I will try my best to break out the pros and cons Pros: -room was GREAT! super clean, spacious and very nice. -staff was great, always were alble to help with any questions - grounds were nice...pool, deli, movie theature and gym were all very nice Cons: - we checked in at night and the building #'s are confusing(not a big deal) - hallway to room was very dark - you only get your room cleaned 1 time per stay, we had to take out our own trash to a dumster in the parking lot. - back of the hotel, by the pool, needed a good pressure wash, was quite moldy! - the pool bar was suppose to open at noon...it stayed closed on both Fri and Sat afternoon...i asked the guy at the deli and he said the bartender was running late and would open it about 2...was at the pool till almost 3:30 and he never showed. Couldnt believe that someone else couldnt open the bar. - they only offered 1 shuttle to the Disney parks and left at 9:30 am (most people are at the park at 8 when they open)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, but too close to the highway”
Reviews.Author: Cunningw
Reviews.Content: The Lighthouse Key Resort looked just like the pictures I saw on the Internet, but a little smaller. The accomodations were very nice and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay there and would recommend it to anyone wanting a nice place to stay while visiting the activities in Florida such as Disney. There were two issues that we had there though. One issue is that the WiFi wasn't very reliable at all. Even the Ethernet connections (2 total in the condo) weren't working. I needed Internet connection in case my job called me with an emergency (I'm the IT guy). I contacted the tech support and they were very responsive. Though the WiFi never really worked reliably one of the ethernet connections did start working so I used that. I had to keep the laptop at the kitchen because I only had a three foot cable. The other issue was due to the fact that the resort is next to a major highway, Rt 192. So there was the constant sound of cars and trucks going down the highway until late evening. I'm from the city (Phila., PA) so being close to a street is not a real big deal. However, one thing that I really want when I go on vacation is peace and quiet. If you want peace and quiet (like I love at Amishview Inn in Bird in Hand, PA) then you should be aware of this. The Beacon Deli on premise was very nice. They had more types of food than I thought they would. The staff there was very friendly and helpful too. They even tried to accomodate my wife when they found out that she was allergic to gluten. I thought the arcade was very lame. The games there looked really old. They used tokens instead of quarters. There wasn't really much I could play. To my surprise there wasn't even a pinball machine! For shame. How can you have an arcade without the standard pinball machine. The swimming pool was very nice. We were fortunate to be there during a time when there weren't many people at all. There was also Karaoke on Thursday nights (if I remember correctly). That was anoying to be honest since our building was next to the activities and I wanted peace and quiet. Another thing that I really liked about Lighthouse Key was its location. It was relatively close to everything. We went to Kennedy Space Center, Flights of Fantasy, Some Disney parks, The Holy Land, and restaurants. Overall Lighthouse Key Resorts was a very nice place to stay. If you don't mind the noise of cars and trucks as background noise (you are not right on the street--perhaps a couple hundred feet) then you will be very happy with Lighthouse Key.

Reviews.Title: “The best one out there!”
Reviews.Author: Cathleen K
Reviews.Content: I took care of the reservations and found this place online for my dad, and stayed here also with my sisters and a friend. From any webpages you can find on reviews and information about you, all is right. Everything we needed were on site. The front desk to the security at the gates are wonderful and the check-in and check-out process twice. They took care of reissuing a new room for us at 6-2001 LK-LK #405 for our extended stay due to Hurricane Irene going up north to New York City and the extending the car rental through All Star was wonderful and fabulous. The pool was great, only twice we used it and the deli...wonderful, food was ultimately the best. The rooms and Internet connection were great except when we moved to a new room, Internet connection weren't that good.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a place, loved it”
Reviews.Author: crockett66
Reviews.Content: the deli and bar have now been taken over and are under new management, the food is absolutly fabulous, if its not on the menu "jon" the cook/owner will make it for you and let me tell you that guy can really cook, if you do stay here then you must try the food and the bar is good fun too, met some really nice people there, very welcoming and obliging , like i say the food is awesome and is a must to try, if you like pizza then jons ya man, he makes the best pizzas ive tasted and the one that i really liked was "tats bad boy " double crust loaded up with different toppings, and the ribs!!!!!!!!!!! wow, do not be afraid to ask about anything to eat ,and i guarentee whatever you have you will love and will go back for more !!!!! do it folks go to the beacon deli n bar , jon dina thanks guys

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: realcre8tive1
Reviews.Content: My family of six stayed at Lighthouse Key and was amazed at the quality of our four-bedroom condo on the top floor. We have made the Disney trip five times staying on property and off and this is by far the best place to stay for the money. The staff is friendly and accommodating, the rooms were immaculate and the price was simply amazing. I highly recommend this property. The only draw back is the view on one side of the building is a moat. But we aren't there for the view.

Reviews.Title: “Beacon deli is ... great”
Reviews.Author: canigetaxm
Reviews.Content: The food is Great And the staff. Super. Duper. Trust the wings. They are the best. Around

Reviews.Title: “Best Deli in Central Florida”
Reviews.Author: LucianLiPera
Reviews.Content: The Beacon Deli is the best kept secret in Central Florida......but not for long. The Deli has the freshest foods in Florida. With the new owner Jon Martin involved in every aspect of the operation everyone is guaranteed good tasting food prepared to your specifications. While the menue is somewhat limited, the food is exceptional and the portions are ample. I come here every Monday to play poker and eat chicken wings, burgers, T-Bone steaks, fresh salmon, all included on the Monday night poker menu. The chili is home made and pastries also home made are incredible. Children are welcome and will enjoy the homemade pizza. The prices are great and the food is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort we've stayed at! Roomy & value for the $”
Reviews.Author: JamieAnn30
Reviews.Content: I'm spoiled & I loved it. Not rich, not even close. But we stayed here for our first week's honeymoon trip with the family and loved it! It's quiet, private, secure and has everything you'd need. It's not like a hotel, but a home away from home. I would recommend it to anyone! Wish we could go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous large rooms, bathrooms and living area. Pool tiny, tiny shop for basic supplies not well stocked. Must have a rental ca”
Reviews.Author: coloradomichelle
Reviews.Content: Definitely would stay here again. Could use some additional kitchen items etc. Lake has big ol alligators, but it's blocked off from resort, so all is safe. 5 people stayed in 3 bedroom with plenty of stretch out room. Nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Firbette
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great: a lovely pool, fantastic condo, helpful folks in the deli. However, our trip was soured by the wifi. One of the reasons we booked here was that it said all condos had free wifi. When we got there, we found that there was never any Internet in the unit, and furthermore, none in the public spaces, including the business center. Whenever we raised the issue with a staff member, we were given stories about broken routers and other equipment failure, but it quickly became clear they were just lying, and didn't care. We mentioned it again as we checked out, and were met with a wan "should I get the manager?". We know that we were not the only ones in this situation. It seems like a small quibble, but it really hampered our vacation planning.

Reviews.Title: “better than our animal kingdom resort”
Reviews.Author: edfromottawa888
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever written on trip advisor and I felt the need to since the lighthouse key resort and spa was the best place we have ever stayed at for the past 5 years that we have been to Orlando. We actually have vacation points with Disney's Animal Kingdom but decided to try a different resort and it was the right choice. Upon checking in we were greeted with friendly staff and check-in was a breeze. We stayed on the third floor, building 1 which was closest to the pool. Upon entering the suite we were amazed as to how spacious it was (3 bedroom suite). The kitchen was a full kitchen with the most modern appliances and granite counters. The berber carpet throughout the suite was super clean. Bedrooms were huge and the beds were super comfortable. I have chronic back pain and for 5 days I woke up pain free...great beds. The ensuite bathrooms were also large and very accommodating. Loved the jucuzzi bath...perfect after a long day at the theme parks. I can go on and on but there are so many nice things I can say about the lighthouse...oh pool was also great...salt water pool. Overall I give this a 5 star rating and will be my first choice if we plan another trip to Orlando. So long Animal Kingdom resort....hello Lighthouse resort and spa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like being hot and like to walk a distance to park.”
Reviews.Author: Bear5652
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we discovered the thermostat could only be lowered to 70 degrees and the room temperature stayed about 76. when we contacted the desk they sent an "engineer" who pointed a temperature sensing light at the outlets and informed us everything was working properly and they could not lower the thermostat any further. He eventually stomped out the door when we argued it was very hot in the bedrooms and wanted the temperature lowered. The next morning two more "engineers" came and gave the same diagnosis. The reason given was the A/C unit would freeze up if it was lowered below 70. Strange but we keep our A/C at 68 or lower and don't have this problem. We contacted the All Star realtor who rents the units about this and was told there was nothing they could do. In essence, if you don't like it, leave. Since it was the week of the fourth of July there were no other three bedroom units anywhere so we stayed and sweated out the heat. Next, when we came in late from one of the worlds, there was no parking available near our building and we were forced to park all the way to the other end of the complex. It is quite a walk from one end to the other. On the positive side the units are very roomy and have ample baths, tv's etc. Just don't expect any help if you are not satisfied, they could care less.

Reviews.Title: “great place for a family”
Reviews.Author: Johnfromlindenhurst
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for one week and the place was great. The rooms were spacious, clean and upscale. Check-in was fast and easy and the room was exactly as promised. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The midweek cleanup was perfect and everything that was used up was replenished. The travel time to the Disney parks was about fifteen minutes, which is sometimes shorter than if you actually stay on Disney property and use their transportation. Using 429 toll road and the West Way entrance to the parks was always traffic free, unlike 192. I would highly recommend this resort for any family that wants to stay near Disney parks and likes alot of space for a very reasonable price. Having a washer and dryer in the rooms allowed us to take a minimal amount of luggage thus getting through the airport was a breeze. We took just three carry-ons for five people and did laundry every couple of days. We will definetly stay here again.Keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ROANDER
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lighthouse Key Resort for 6 nights while visiting Disney World. The proximity of the resort to Disney World is great. Not as close as staying on Disney property, but not far enough to notice the difference. We stayed in one of the 2 bedroom suites. Loved that we had the ability to do laundry over our vacation! Can't say enough about what a convenience this was! Although, I must say that the washer and dryer are very loud while operating. The appearance of the suite was good. You could tell that some of the furniture was beginning to wear, but nothing too serious. Loved the master bathroom, and the beds were very comfortable. Absolutely loved the balcony as we enjoyed having dinner out there with good views of the Kissimmee/Orlando area. The service was ok. Check in was easy and we were able to find our suite easily. We had our suite cleaned mid week and the cleaning job was sufficient. The resort has an awesome pool, but needs to be cleaned more often. There was one day when it felt like we were swimming in a stew of dead bugs though. This was corrected the next day. The hot tub could use some stronger jets, but overall it is still nice. I found the bar service to be slow at times. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad service - the staff is great, but they could be a little more attentive. The cable in our building was out for most of our stay (Sunday through Thursday) due to a converter box that had gone bad. The staff offered to loan out some DVD's at no extra charge and kept the pool area open an extra 2 hours to make up for the inconvenience. Nice offerings, but when you're on vacation, you expect everything to work and if not working, be fixed more quickly. The resort is beautiful and the buildings and landscaping are well maintained. The only "eyesore" is the abandoned construction on the property. It's not a bother, but needs to be mentioned. The theater and gym on property are also great amenities. The Lighthouse Key Resort was a great place to stay for our Disney World vacation. The price per night that we paid was definitely worth it as you get tons more than what Disney offers at their resorts for a higher price. I highly recommend the Lighthouse Key Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent”
Reviews.Author: Geosdad
Reviews.Content: There is very little that I can add to the great remarks other reviewers have made other than saying this place is excellent value. I just paid $189 per night for 3 nights for an excellent well appointed, clean, luxurious and very comfortable 4 bedroom apartment for me, my partner and our 3 teenage children. If you are in Orlando and visiting the parks you will not beat this place, and the staff are fantastic as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and relaxing luxury resort near Disney!”
Reviews.Author: GoofyMommy
Reviews.Content: This is our 7th year visiting Walt Disney World! We normally stay on Disney property at the Animal Kingdom, Beach Club, or Polynesian Resorts; however, we planned to visit other Orlando area attractions on this vacation since we took the Amtrak AutoTrain (had our vehicle with us). After much research, we decided to stay off-property at Lighthouse Key Resort and Spa to save some money to allow for the extended vacation (May 1-17, 2011). We rented a 4-bedroom villa on the 5th floor and we were so happy that we did!!! Services: We were greeted warmly at the front gate upon our arrival and directed to the lobby concierge to hold our luggage. We arrived early because we needed to pick up another party member at the airport. En route to the airport we were phoned to let us know that our villa was ready for occupancy two hours earlier than anticipated. Prior to our arrival we were aware of the "Green" policy of the resort and the resultant limited housekeeping. That fact was welcome to us since we prefer to maintain our privacy during our vacations and don't feel the need to change linens/towels daily (though we had the ability to wash them between housekeeping days, as needed). The front desk graciously held several packages that were delivered to the resort for us. Each day that a package arrived, we received a phone call to alert us of its arrival and the hours available for pick-up. The front office staff were always very friendly and accommodating. The Villa/Rooms: The villa was exactly as pictured on the website! It was astonishing to note all of the care that was taken to decorate and maintain the unit! It reflected understated tropical elegance, a style similar to that done by Tommy Bahama. I won't reiterate the layout or features of the rooms since the website photos show exactly what we anticipated and found; however, I will say that the beds were very comfortable, with firm mattresses and comfortable covers (similar to what you would get on-property). Each of the bathrooms had plenty of body, hand, and wash towels. Nice quality facial soap, body soap, shampoo, and lotion were provided initially and during each cleaning in each bathroom. The two master bathrooms had jetted tubs (VitaBath, I think). I used it on one occasion, but found the jets to be too noisy late at night. They are very nice though in that the water level doesn't need to be very high in order to use it and that you can add essential oils to the bath while using the jets (unlike Jacuzzi bathtubs). Amenities: The kitchen was fantastic - Beautiful countertops, nice appliances (though I prefer gas stovetops to electric), and ample storage space. It had all of the ordinary kitchen needs: dinnerware, utensils, glassware, knives, blender, cutting board, pots/pans, potholders, towels, wash rags, a new scrub pad, handwash dishwashing liquid, and sample-size dishwasher powder. The dishwasher was a bit loud, but we just ran it when we were headed out for the day. None of us used the spa services, but two of us used the exercise facility and found it to be very well maintained with all of the essential equipment (all Precor), hand weights, and towels. We toured the theater, which was nicer than pictured online; but we didn't have time in our plans to take in a movie. All of us enjoyed the pool on three of our evenings: It was small, quiet, and restful after a long day at the parks. The sign to the pool states "no outside food or drink allowed," however the poolside food establishment was never open when we visited it. We didn't need any food at the pool, but I did wonder if we were allowed to bring in something when the eating establishment was closed. I never inquired further about it. Location: We absolutely loved our location! We were about 3 miles from Disney's main gate, 10 miles from Sea World, and about 15 miles from Universal Studios. I read reviews about traffic congestion on 192, but we didn't have any issues with it during our stay. The resort was very accessible from both the Amtrak AutoTrain station and the Orlando airport. We prefer to eat at local establishments during vacations. Two dining places that we researched off-property and enjoyed were rated well on yelp.com: 1) Jerusalem Restaurant had a very authentic feel and wonderful food. Service was fast and very good. 2) Flippers, a local pizza place near Super Target was very good. I especially liked their chicken Caesar salad. The manager (owner?) was honestly concerned with customers having a wonderful meal and enjoying his food/services. DO NOT try "Passage to India!" I've never had such a horrible meal! Relatively expensive, yet served/prepared by people who could barely say the names of the dishes, let alone make them with authenticity. If one of our party members hadn't insisted that we stay and try it, I would have left immediately. What I liked best: Wonderful low-cost vacation off-property. Privacy Location Villa amenities Staff friendliness (They were very happy people...all of them.) What I liked least: Loud dishwasher (but we ran it while we were away) Loud laundry appliances (but it has a door to the room to shut out the noise) View from the balcony (abandoned construction- but we had hardly any opportunity to use it anyway) Overall, I would definitely stay at this resort again when visiting Disney and/or other area attractions. It truly felt like a magical vacation...as good as or better than when we've stayed on Disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely....so much better than a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: caroline188
Reviews.Content: We normally stay in five star hotel accommodation but wanted more space which is why we booked this. We were absolutely delighted with the property. It was like having our own Floridian apartment. It was spotlessly clean, great decor and the staff were so welcoming. Location was great, close enough to the parks but at the same time far enough away from the madness. We felt very safe there. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: esurman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights with small children. The facility was excellent and the staff is great. The condo was in fantastic shape and very quiet. We would defintely stay there again. It's about 15-20 minutes to Disney in heavy traffic but not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TammyT77
Reviews.Content: I am always nervous when looking online for places to stay while on vacation because I am extremely picky however this resort was exactly what is says online. It was very clean, nicely furnished, and comfortable. We had two 4 bedroom condos and it was enough room for our young children as well as our teenagers. I have no complaints at all. It is worth every penny!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: MichelePicard
Reviews.Content: Very clean, spacious, beautiful condos, close to everything. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a 3 bedroom, 3 bath unit on the ground floor closest to the pool - loved it! The pool is heated and welcoming, towels provided. Glad to be able to do laundry and make some meals. We will be back! Great bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, large rooms, new”
Reviews.Author: Dallasfamwithteens
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week with my wife and 3 teens for 6 nights. We had a 3 bedroom unit. The unit itself was perfect for us as we all had our own private areas and plenty of room . The unit was like new and very clean. Nice kitchen area, bathrooms, etc.. Photos are accurate on the web site. This is a different feel than you would get at a huge resort. The place is relatively small. Pool and "club house" areas were nice, but nothing over the top. Reasonably laid back and quiet, a good place to decompress after the intensity of the parks. They have a bar and a small deli at the pool which was nice. The gym is also decent sized with a good range of equipment. We also used the pool tables and had fun. No cost for any of this except for drinks/food which were very reasonable (i.e. not Disney-like). The location is decent in proximity to Disney given that you have to drive (we did not use the shuttle). It took us about 20 minutes door to door (30 minutes to Universal). Not a big deal. There is some traffic and a bunch of lights on 192 (the road that the property sits on). The last day we took 429 (highway very close to the property). That is probably a quicker way to go (avoids most of the lights), but you have to pay $1 for a toll. We were able to get low season rates because we booked the week prior, this made what would have been a very good value an excellent one. The property and adjacent area itself can be pretty or ugly depending on which way you are facing. Nice lake and view from the pool. However, it looks like they stopped construction at roughly 20% of the units when the crisis hit. As a result there is are large open lots, not landscaped in any way. This takes away form the place a little, it will be much nicer whenever they finish the whole thing, but this will also make the central areas more crowded (you are able take advantage of this now). Also, you have a nice view of the trailerpark-esque community that sits maybe a quarter of a mile away. We had debated staying on property at Disney or Universal, but that would have either left us in very cramped quarters (not good with teens) or been prohibitively expensive. We are glad that we made the choice we did. All in all, we were very satisfied with the property and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to vacation after a Disney stay”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Bum_In_Vegas
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay as a vacation after Disney. The three bedroom/three bath suites were large enough for everyone to spread out. Two of the bathrooms had jetted tubs which felt lovely on my achy legs. It was nice to be able to do all the laundry from Disney while I ran off their spa for a massage. Great value and nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort just minutes to Disney”
Reviews.Author: quiver-ridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days in February and will return here each time we return to Orlando. Much cheaper than staying at Disney and only minutes away. You can also see the Magic Kingdom fireworks at night if you get a room that faces the lake. Staff was excellent. Great pool and workout facility.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Luxury Condos for a short or long visit to Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Travelinkers
Reviews.Content: These are beautiful luxury condos with gracious, upscale decor in spacious accommodations. Everything is sparkling with all the modern conveniences. The 2-3-4 bedrooms have great accommodations for families, couples or adults traveling to the Orlando area. We were extremely impressed and Lighthouse Key Resort defiinitely exceeded our expectations. Plenty of amenities are available including a great fitness center, movie theater, game/billiard room, free internet, and a beautiful pool. It was convenient to attractions and has complimentary shuttles to the Disney Parks. Great for a short stay or monthly stay. Even has washer and dryers in the units.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: 5StarBermuda
Reviews.Content: Found this resort on line after carrying out numerous searches. Stayed 19-23 Dec prior to cruising and returned after cruising 1-7; stayed an extra 3 nights. Lighthouse Keys had everything that we were looking for in accommodations and also the price was right!! The staff went over and above from housekeeping right up to management. Didn't get a chance to check out the Spa, unfortunately. Excellent exercise facility. Games room and a movie theater. Very quiet during the day and night - good for some R & R. There is a deli at the resort which provides the best sandwiches, salads and home made soup for those who wish to stay in. The only downside was that their pantry did not have much in supplies but a Super TarJ is just mins away.... One thing for sure...... some online websites tell untruths and show false pics. Lighthouse Keys website is for real. Paid upfront before I travelled.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! a Great Holiday to Remember”
Reviews.Author: cfsnco
Reviews.Content: Our stay started out with a good check-in followed by a great condo rental. Our 3 bedroom had 2 masters and a third bedroom with two single beds. Slept 6 very comfortable. The place looked new and not just the condo but the whole resort. It's only two buildings, swimming pool, game room, etc. We loved this place and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: mimi601
Reviews.Content: I just spend time there for thanksgiving with my family it was such a wonderful place to stay we had such a beautiful experience all the staff member are such wonderful and friendly people I want to give special thanks to the supervisor Miriam she gave me and my wife a tour in 2 other units which will make us go again and reserve an upper level and for the security of our kids which they have a unit with a secure porch. Next year we will go back for a longer time.__===

Reviews.Title: “Very Large, Very Nice and great Price”
Reviews.Author: m_r_d_atl
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Lighthouse Key for the second time and if you are looking for a large space that is very nice at a great price this is it. We had 6 adults, one 4 year old and one 9 month old in a 4 bedroom unit and had plenty of room. There is a large kitchen so we were able to eat breakfast at the condo everyday as well as do some laundry in the full size washer and dryer. It is a relatively easy 10-15 minute drive to all the disney parks via the toll road that is 1 light away from the resort. You still have to deal with parking etc at the parks so it would be a pain if you are looking to come back for naps during the day. The condo is very new and furnished nicely. If you need more space than a standard hotel room that is very nice, reasonably close to Disney at a great price this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Aitkens
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three week holiday in Florida, where we stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for the first week and Lighthouse Key Resort for the other two weeks. The Resort is beautiful, the rooms massive, with jacuzzi baths in two bedrooms and flat screen tvs in nearly every room. There was two pools and jacuzzi which were virtually empty every time we were there, the deli does lovely sandwiches and baguettes. Disney parks and the Premium outlets were 10-15 minutes away and lots of great restaurants 2 minutes away. ( TGI fridays a few minutes away was the best meal of the whole holiday) Would definately return here, it was a gem of a place.

Reviews.Title: “The Definition of Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Classic_Breeze
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Lighthouse Key Resort through stayhereplayhere.com. This place is magnificent. It has everything from an excercise room to a movie theatre with free movies. Pros: Everything. The kitchens are huge with marble granite finish. The bedrooms are actually bedrooms with a huge master bathroom. We stayed in a three bedroom with a balcony. The staff provided fresh towels and linens daily. The grounds are very well kept. The property has two large swimming pools. Oh ladies, you can enjoy the spa while your husband enjoys the pool. The kids can gain exposure to the huge arcade room. This place can be compared to a palace with the palace hospatality. There were days I didn't even want to explore Orlando- but just stay indoors. Even though it is large and accomodates many- it is very peaceful and quiet. You cannot hear through the walls. I will never even consider staying anywhere other than Lighthouse Key Resort when in the Orlando Area. Cons and Least Like: The day I had to depart! (lol) You will not be disappointed in any way with this resort. Once you stay at this resort it will be the last resort for you. (get it-last resort!) LOL

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Clean Resort.”
Reviews.Author: 2intx
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was great! It did start out bumpy and I was mad; however, Eric at the front desk went out of his way to help us out. Here's the break-down of our stay: The Room: To make a long story short, our top floor room we reserved in March was given away, and they placed us in a third floor room. I was not happy about this at all! I don't know who is to blame... someone at the front desk or the reservation people. We reserved a 4 bedroom 3 bath room. We had the paperwork with the room number we reserved on it, and the room was given to someone else earlier in the week. I had read reviews on here about hearing the people above you. We were placed on the third floor in the same type of room. The reviews about hearing the people above you are very true, but it's not too bad. (If you are sensitive to sound like I am, it will drive you nuts.) Luckily, the people above us had kids so when we got back each night they were asleep. The downfall is they were up every morning by 7:00am sounding like they were running a marathon... needless to say, I was awake too... That's why I wanted the 5th floor! Eric at the front desk was very nice though, since we didn't get what we paid for, he comped us a night and refunded our early check in (because our room wasn't ready on time.) We were also given a free lunch for our entire group (we had 8 people) at their deli while our room was getting cleaned. The sandwiches were very good. The Internet: This was another complaint I saw on here. When I tried to hook up to the wireless it did not work. I called the number the front desk told me too, and got the same story of “we have an engineer working on it…” They told me to call back in an hour if it wasn’t working, so I did. This time I talked to someone who knew what they were doing. My Windows was blocking out their server, we did a few quick settings changes and it worked perfectly! I called back the day we left to change the settings back to normal. Cleanliness, Value, and Location: This place is very clean and nice. It is practically new and is kept up well. Since we stayed a week, we had a complimentary cleaning on Wednesday. I believe this resort was well worth our money! It is near Disney and SeaWorld. There are grocery stores nearby; we went to a Publix that was a mile up the road. There are lots of restaurants too nearby. I would highly recommend this resort. Just beware you may not get the room you request. The Spa: My niece and I got pedicures the Tuesday of our stay. The spa is very nice and clean, and our toes turned out great! The spa staff was very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay”
Reviews.Author: landry1
Reviews.Content: Last year our family took a sort of reunion trip to Disney and we stayed at Lighthouse. Everyone raved about the resort and really enjoyed themselves. So this year my husband and I decided to return to the resort for our anniversary; this time without the kids. We had a two bedroom that was as nice as the three bedroom we had last year. Our only complaints this trip was that we were given a room with an inoperable jacuzzi tub which was something my husband and I enjoyed on our previous stay. Also the knob on the dryer in the laundry room had to be manuvered to work and once the dryer started it was very loud. We called the front desk but no one ever came to check on it. Also, we noticed that every music channel was available except for BET which we would have like to watched at some point. Lastly, the young lady who checked us in was not friendly at all. She did not give us a list of amenities or services as her co-worker was doing with another couple checking in at the same time. Although we were returning customers, I feel she could have been more welcoming. Other than these incidents, we still consider Lighthouse one of our favorite spots to vacation and will probably return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place we have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: LadyFan55
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 with 3 pre-teen/teen boys. We used our II membership and traded into a 2B/2B. Reading that the 2nd bedroom had a twin bed w/ a trundle, we contacted the resort and they allowed us to buy up to the 3/3 for a reasonable fee. We booked this resort before our previous trip to Orlando In Oct of 2009. When we arrived in Orlando, we visited the Resort just to check it out. The staff allowed us to tour one of the suites, as well as walk around. What we saw was impressive and we where excited. Let me say that not many resorts will allow you to do a quick, self guided tour, this was truly awesome of them. Suite Condition ~ Gorgeous décor, very, very clean. Everything was brand new. This resort is breathtaking! The rooms are huge, and I mean huge. It is a quiet resort. We never heard our neighbors, but we were on the top floor. 3b/3b ~ consists of 2 master bedrooms and a 3rd bedroom with 2 twin beds: Master bedroom # 1 ~ King size bed, a desk w/a lamp that has a DSL plug, flat screen TV (had to get that serviced, which they fixed the next day while we where at the park), nice bathroom with private toilet, double sink w/typical counter space, Jacuzzi, glass wall shower, large walk in closet and a dressing area with full length mirrors. Master bedroom # 2 ~ King size bed, (no desk here as the space saved went to the bathroom) flat screen TV (we had to re-set this TV nightly by unplugging and plugging it back in), big bathroom with private toilet, double sink in a very large vanity with draws galore (very nice!), Jacuzzi, glass wall shower, large walk in closet and a dressing area with full length mirrors. Bedroom # 3 ~ compared to the other rooms, this one is much smaller, it has 2 twin beds, not many draws and the closet is smaller. There is a TV. Beds & pillows ~ high quality and very comfortable. We all got great nights sleep every night. Kitchen ~ very well appointed. beautiful counters, cabinets and appliances. We lacked nothing in the very large kitchen. There is an island where the sink and dishwasher are. Island also had a counter w/stools and a DSL plug. Living room ~ one couch and 2 chairs. Very pretty, but would have preferred 2 couches for a 3b/3b unit. Nice big flat screen TV. Patio ~ decent size patio w/table and chairs. It is not screened in. We had a view of a lake, Orange Lake Resort (their poolside activities are all we heard during the week. Sounded like they were having a great time over there, not bad/too loud). In the distance, each night we could see the Epcot fireworks at 9p and Magic Kingdom's at 10p. Laundry room - there is an actual laundry room. This allowed us a place to put our dirty clothes before we got around to washing them in the full size w&d. They did supply a small amount of detergent. We have learned to bring our own and drier sheets. Timeshare presentation ~ we were never asked. Check-in/out ~ service was immediate! Service ~ everyone was nice. Not outgoing, but pleasant. Pool area ~ clean, quiet and not very crowded. The pool area has 1 hot tub, 1 U-shape zero entry pool that was a perfect temperature, and 1 smaller lap pool that is cooler. There are no other outside activities, so if you like lots of activities, you will not get it here. There is an ice-cream/sandwich shop and a pool side bar. For this reason they allow NO outside drinks or food. I think this ends up hurting them. If you let people bring in snacks and non-glass/non-alcohol drinks, others that may not have any will see, get hungry/thirsty and buy. Activities ~ There is a theater for watching movies. We never used this. Fitness Center ~ Very nice. Big with a wide variety of equipment and free weights. I used it almost every morning and never encountered more than 1 or 2 other people at a time. Wi-Fi ~ this is where they need improvement. We had poor Wi-Fi. We got the resort across the lake (Orange Lake) better than Lighthouse Key's Wi-Fi. We finally had to borrow a DSL cable from the front desk. There where only 2 places to plug in, a plug on the kitchen island, this is in a fine location, but it did not work. The other was in the lamp on the desk in the 1st Master Bedroom, this is the only place we could get consistent, reliable to Inet service. Business Center ~ well appointed. Printed out 5 boarding passes in 3 minutes. Grounds ~ Resort is on a lake. It appears by the scale model they have they plan on putting in a beach, for now it is a marsh that you cannot go to. There is not much landscaping, but what is there is pleasant. Location ~ About 30 min's and 2 tolls from MCO (bring about $5 in change to drive to & from the airport, and a bit more if you plan to go to the beach). 5-10 min's to WDW, 20-30 min's to Seaworld and Universal. No tolls to get to the parks. Resort is on the west end of Irlo Bronson, so it is a little farther to restaurants than most of the other resorts on this busy, tourist strip. Summary ~ This Resort is Spectacular. We love to try different resorts, but we really want to get back here as soon as the timing works in our favor. NOTE - this is a Timeshare. You may or may not get items like coffee, soap & shampoo and there is no housekeeping unless you pay for it (we did get a mid week housekeeping service that included making the beds). This is no reason to grade them low. Just do your homework first, that way there will be no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “The Resort and its ammenities set the mood for and unbelievable time”
Reviews.Author: dt3248
Reviews.Content: The drive up to the view of the front gated security entrance had already set my mind at ease being in an unfamiliar place. The Resort itself is just beautiful and obvisouly well maintaned. An in house movie theatre, game room, well equiped workout facility, 0 to 8ft pool and heated Jacuzzi were just the outside. The Rooms were sapcious (we had the 4 bedroom). The rooms were clean and so fully equiped all we had to do was just get some groceries and nothing else. The trash was an easy sit it out the front door for a daily pick up. It even provided a Vaccum cleaner if needed. The Resort is just 9 miles west of Disney resorts and within 2 miles of a mad choci list of restaurants and night clubs. We are just too pleased with our 5 day stay and plan to book another already. You just can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: happycondogirl
Reviews.Content: I am so picky and this place was great beautiful condo roomy clean nice decor awsome for 4 bedrooms and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Great place, amazing value, a few things to note though”
Reviews.Author: squeegee10
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at LKRS. It truly is great value for money. Forget all the reviews that say their are ants. Whilst we saw none, seriously if there were a few ants and because of that you provided a poor review....whooopdy do! I am travelling with my family of 4 (kids are 8 and 12). We have been travelling the US for 2 weeks, and viewed this as a "refresher with our own space again". The rooms are large, and everyone has their own space here, which is great. Everything is fresh and new. The gym is excellent, the pool is great too, and there is an excellent games room. For families this place is excellent, and particularly excellent value for money. It is close to everything. Disney is 15 minutes (dont bother with that though, read my review on disney), NASA an hour, Discovery cove 20 minutes, and there are shops everywhere, with food galore. The negatives, and these are our experiences. We had a bottom floor unit, and the elephants upstairs were the biggest annoyance. It is hard to understand why a building that is a resort wouldnt be constructed with slab floors. We found this very annoying, as you could hear everything from upstairs. I did compain, and could have been moved to the top floor, but I declined as the persons were moving out that day. So if you are staying, request a top floor. The other really annoying thing was the wireless internet. It is not up to scratch, and the resort "doesnt handle their internet service". So you have to deal with their provider. We had 2 PCs, and neither could work at the one time. We spent 50 minutes waiting before we gave up. Then tried later and spoke to someone "well get an engineer to look at it and call back". No call back, and it wasnt fixed. I just went and got a cat5 cable, and we used cable the time we were here. I normally judge all places by "would I come back". The answer here is definitely, but with the above changes.

Reviews.Title: “hard to believe how nice and spacious for the price”
Reviews.Author: m_r_d_atl
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at Lighthouse key. We had a 3 bedroom, 3 bath with 4 adults and 2 kids. We have always stayed on Disney property which gets really expensive when you need 2-3 rooms. For the price of a hotel room we had more space than we knew what to do with and it was really nice. It is basiclly a nearly new spacious appartment with full kitchen etc..We were on the top floor, had a great view of a lake and could even see the epcot fireworks at night. If you take the toll road the back way to disney there is almost no traffic. There is a big downside to not staying on property when Disney is busy. It takes forever to get into magic kingdom when you dont have a Disney bus drop you off up front. The other parks are not so bad and I dont think it would have been so bad if it was not such a busy weekend. So if you need a lot of space for large extended families for a great price and are willing to deal with the hassle of staying off property than I think you will love the Lighthouse Key

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, friendly staff, close to attractions, awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: Renee1913
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LightHouse Key for 6 nights. We had a 3 bedroom/3 bath unit and it was beautiful! The unit was quite spacious, had great furnishings, was really quiet, and the staff was friendly and attentive. We would definitely like to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay - lots of things to do and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: GoMSUDawgs
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week and had a great time. The staff was very friendly and took care of any requests. The only problem we had is that our room was not available till about 1 hour after the check-in time. The room had plenty of space, was clean, and had everything we needed for our stay. The hotel was able to provide a pack and play for our infant which saved a large amount of baggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo resort for family.”
Reviews.Author: sdonna2
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this resort twice and absolutely loved it. Quiet loacation but within driving distance to Disney attractions, friendly staff, clean and spacious units . . . great for a family with teens.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Resort”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityJakedog
Reviews.Content: Overall my husband and I really enjoyed this resort. It is around two years old and the furnishings are very nice. The bed in the master bedroom is very comfortable and the unit has most everything we needed. We did however have the ant problem that I have seen in several other reviews. We notified front desk and they did come and spray. The second bedroom is a little small. It was a trundle bed. We did a timeshare presentation at Raddison World Gate. The manager's name was Fabian. He is rude and high pressure. He is what gives timeshares a bad name. Stay clear of the the Driftwood property presentation. The Lighthouse Key Resort does not have a sales team at this time, so all timeshares are done off propery.

Reviews.Title: “LK Resort is very clean, with large, nicely furnished rooms,”
Reviews.Author: parfiven2
Reviews.Content: We utilized World Points rewards for this layover trip to Orlando prior to a cruise vacation. The accomodations were perfect. Better than what the internet pictures showed. Unit was very clean w/ flatscreens in each bedroom and x-box for kids. Nice pool and above average fitness center. No "timeshare" pressure. Our 3rd floor room overlooked a golf course that was part of a neighboring resort. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: mcgroog
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews regarding Lighthouse Key before we booked however it is without doubt beautiful accommodation, clean and of a high quality. Check in was efficient and a breeze. Staff at the Resort were very friendly and helpful. The accomodation is of a very high quality and faultless and the daily newspaper each day was nice touch(although you do pay for it!!) The quality of the fixture and fittings was excellent and the view of the lake from our condo was lovely. We did have an ant problem - even on the top floor, but the maintenance man did come and spray the patio and kitchen. There is a walmart a few miles down the road on the 27 but it was easier and better to go to the Super Target(Tesco's) up the road for food and drink and it also it has a far better selection. Also we bought some ant spray for $3 and sorted the ant problem as we went - it saves having to get the maintenance man out!! We rented out a Xbox from reception for the kids, it is free but it only comes with one controller so if you have a couple of teenagers bring a second controller!! The pool area was lovely and uncrowded at all times although the pool bar did close early if there was no one around in the evening however this is run by sub contract and not by the complex. We stayed at the Bahama Bay last year, and while nice, the Lighthouse Key is far more upmarket, quieter and friendlier. We will happily return next year. In short a top class, well maintained, efficient resort with the best accomodation we have come across in the usa.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT”
Reviews.Author: chachies
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is thanks Lighthouse Key Resort and Spa for a great service and wonderfull summer vacation We enjoy our stay. The villa was excelent and spacious The staff was very helpful and courtious. You bet we will return

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Excellence”
Reviews.Author: VFirst
Reviews.Content: The customer service was excellent. Asst Gen manager was a quality leader. The apartment was first class, 3 bed luxury, 3 bath with whirlpool, fully aircon, internet facility flat screen every room with 42" in lounge, dining, balcony over looking disney back and a lake with fire works, and many more we re surely going to miss this place - other amenties on resort is swimming, gym, games room, spa, restaurant, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: jhnsngirl04
Reviews.Content: How do I start this off? I booked this place through a timeshare. I have read some of the reviews about this place, however, I just had to try it out! First of all, we had problems with ants! Then, we had to go to Walmart to purchase towels because we were only allowed 4 towels, however, we had 6 people in the room with us. Internet service didnt work! There was a bad odor in the elevator, therefore, we had to take the stairs. They charge you for room service, however, you only get room service one time. Upon checkout, I get this big bill stating that I owe them for room service, tax, etc. Then, two days later, I get another charge on my card for something else. I have called this place several times trying to speak with someone and has yet to return my call about the charges. I will definitely not return to this place, again! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort...Staff Doesn't Follow Through”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulMind504
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from this resort following a week long vacation. The resort is rather small but gated. The security guards that greeted us were very friendly. We proceeded to check in and was helped by Eric. He was nice. At the desk we were told of some of the amenities offered at the resort, all of them being housed in that location. The lobby was spacious and the grounds were clean. The pool area was nice with plenty lounge chairs available. There's a poolside bar, as well as, a deli/store. We were given our room assignment and rode over to Building 1. We decided to keep the luggage inside the car since we didn't see a luggage cart. When we got to our room we noticed the latch lock was placed on the outside so the door wouldn't close all the way. We hesitated but pushed to door open. To our surprise, the room was occupied. We apologized to the guest and proceeded back to the front desk. The elevators aren't air conditioned. We told Eric of our problem. He gave us another room. I must also mention that my brother and his family travelled along with us and was first given an occupied room also. We got to our room. I must say I was impressed. It was nice 3BR/3BA. The room was clean and well stocked. The patio area was also nice. We were on the 5th floor and did notice a trail of ants out there. This is a minor problem that didn't bother me. The kids enjoyed their time at the pool between theme parks. We also played billiards in the gameroom. The gameroom also had a handul of arcade games along with an air hockey table. XBOX 360 consoles are available at the front desk with a credit card hold. You must bring your own games or rent them from the onsite deli/store for a fee of $5/day. They also rent DVDs for that same price. Besides being sent to an occupied room, my gripe came on Wednesday when we were due to have a complimentary mid-week cleaning and restocking by the housekeeping staff. On Thursday, I called the front desk to inquire about this to Eric who said he would radio housekeeping to check the status and get them over to us. Well, Friday came but housekeeping didn't. I called the front desk and requested to speak to a manager and was told that one wasn't available. I went on the tell them that I wanted fresh towels. They bought them over right away and called to confirm that it was done. Otherwise, I didn't have any major issues. Everyone we came in contact with in passing offered a smile. One perk to the room was that we were able to view the fireworks display at Disney nightly at 10pm. I would give this resort another try. My only wish is that it was better managed to iron out those minor kinks.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...gorgeous, new rooms!”
Reviews.Author: OhioDisneyMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Feb 2009 in 3 BR, 3 bath. The check-in took 1 minute, room was ready at noon arrival. Lobby is impressive... with game room and 50 seat theater right there. Accomodations are very nice; new and clean. Fully stocked kitchen, large dining and living room with big screen TV. Two master BR with king bed, large walk- in closet and very roomy bathroom. The third BR has twin and twin trundle and uses the hall bath. Called for maint. to replace batteries in TV remote. They were at the door within 5 minutes. PROS: Love the decor and layout. Master baths are huge. 3rd bath is a plus. Very quiet. Great pool area with bar and deli. Paid $150/night thru endlessrentals.com and felt it was well worth it. Four TV's. Elevators. Gated entry. Lots of restaurants nearby, but it was nice to eat breakfast in room. CONS: Not many, but not a big fan of Hwy 192 area. You do feel secluded inside the resort area though. 20 minute drive to Disney with all the traffic. While the 2 king beds and 1 twin worked out for my family (me, dad and brother), thought it would be awkward not having 2 queen/dbls in one of the suites. Overall, would recommend this resort without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: thirstygrunt
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great service. Everything very spacious, very clean, and very livable. Rooms were well stocked with everything we needed, and there were plenty of stores across the street for food and extras. Everyone in our 8 person party loved this beautiful resort, and we will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but not friendly at all”
Reviews.Author: westmichigander
Reviews.Content: We had problems from the moment we drove in the driveway. The guard was rude, the check in lady pretty much said here's your key and thanks. We had to ask which way to even go. We went to the pool with the kids and brougth some snacks and a couple of bottles of water for the kids and a couple of drinks for the adults and we're pretty much kicked out. NO FOOD OR DRINKS OF ANY KIND ALLOWED IN POOL AREA. Ok i understand them wanting us to purchase their stuff but this is going too far. They have tables chairs etc. They also have a large grill....but nope we cant use it. Not friendly at all. And to top all this off, The bar only has beer and wine and the deli is another joke. It doesnt do any good to complain about any of that either, the bar and deli is owned or rented by another company. Ok, the building and rooms we're awesome. That's it. SO in a nutshell. It's not kid friendly if you want to use the pool area. And the bar/snack bar is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more perfect”
Reviews.Author: Familyof5Mn
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 7 and it was beyond perfect! 5 Star all the way. It was so wonderful to have a leisurely breakfast each morning, and saved us a ton of $$, and then being able to pack some snacks and waters for our days at the parks in a backpack and off we went (tip to take the toll for $1.00 WELL worth saving the traffic!). The rooms were VERY spacious, clean, wonderful room to relax and unwind after long days. The Deli has GREAT food (service is slow but VERY friendly and food delicious). Pool was wonderful, plenty of space. Front desk was helpful. I would love to keep this place a secret so when we return it is a fabulous as our 9 day visit was. The view from the balcony of our 4 bedroom had some to be desired but still 5 star - once they sell more units it will be more to see.

Reviews.Title: “Needless worries.”
Reviews.Author: fantastic40
Reviews.Content: We got back from Florida 4 days ago. We are a family of 5 and had booked this holiday for my 40th birthday and my youngests 7th birthday. At the time of booking we were nervous as it was our first family vacation to Florida. Having read reviews of Lighhouse Key it seemed you either loved or hated it. We LOVED it. Kara answered our questions before leaving the UK via email and on arrival was equally as helpful. The condo looked just like it does on their website. It was super clean and non of the 'complaints' on here seem justified to us. The ant problem must of happened at some point as a man did come in mid-vacation to treat any potential recurrence but we didn't see any. The kitchen is large so can appear somewhat understocked. As for the area not being too good - it seems to us to be up and coming with plenty of new restaurants and supermarkets. (Longhorn steak house had people queuing out of the door every night). There were a couple of old motels which should be pulled down now but other than that it was super. From the condo to Disney parks was appoximately at 10 minute drive, depending on traffic - the 192 can get busy. There was a shuttle service to the parks included in the $7 a day resort fee but the schedule didn't suit our needs. You do have to pay $12 parking at the parks daily so some people may wish to consider this. The pool and pool area was clean and well maintained. The deli isn't very well stocked but useful for emergency milk or wine! Overall I would definitely recommend the Lighthouse Key to anyone looking for 5* accommodation in Orlando. Can't say I'd recommend Virgin flights booking in system though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort Rest and Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: Orlandojunkees
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Resort with my wife and children and must say that we had a flawless stay. The rooms are absolutely beautiful, the staff was great and for a small property there was a lot to do. Whether it was relaxing at the pool, watching a movie in the resorts theatre, shooting pool or just hanging out in the room, we couldn't get enough. Plus the resort is located just around the corner from Disney. I would recommend this property to everyone and I am sure that we will be going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeMarco
