Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lighthouse Key Resort for our spring break. I have to say I was very disappointed with the experience. First, the unit was not very clean when we arrived, for example all of the stainless steel appliances looked like they had been wiped down with a dirty rag. My sister and her husband had to call at 1100pm for sheets because they put a full sheet on a queen size bed (it did not even tuck under). But the biggest problem was our refrigerator stopped working during the night which ruined some of our food. We reported this to management the next day and were told to bring our receipts to the office with a list of the food that spoiled. They did switch our refrigerator out but never addressed the issue of the food. I asked the front desk person before we left and she gave us a number to one of the property managers- the call was never returned. This resort has potential but it will never reach it if they continue to ignore their guest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but read before booking...”
Reviews.Author: SandraWhitman
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, we were told our room was not ready and after trying a couple of times to get a hold of housekeeping, the clerk said "It is tough because they don't speak English"...He also tried to get the manager of housekeeping and they didn't even answer the call. While out shopping, we got the call the unit was ready and upon arriving, we discovered a plate of maple syrup under sink on the bottom of cabinet. There wasn't any dish detergent, dishwashing soap (were told there would be), no potholders or dishtowels and therefore had to use bathroom towels, and also, the tile floors were sticky. We called the front desk to complain about the syrup, floors and pillows, and were told by the clerk that she gave out the last pillow the day before and someone would come up to clean the floor...which he did and trust me, he spoke very good English. So there were 4 adults using 3 pillows - and one of the guys gave his wife his pillow and used the big round bolster pillow and suffered a stiff neck the next day! Went to make breakfast the next morning and there was a tiny frying pan for cooking and since there weren't any potholders, we had to use bathroom towels. So after a sleepless night, and eating in shifts, we stopped at the front desk before heading out and asked to speak to a manager. The clerk said the manager wasn't in and asked if she could help. We said no because we didn't get anywhere with the front desk and wanted the manager. She said he would be in the next day and gave us his card. We didn't stay at the resort that night and called the front desk upon arriving back at the resort and called the front desk asking to speak to the manager as we wanted to complain. When the manager came on the phone, we asked him to come to the unit and gave him a list of what was wrong. He apologized and said that the "no more pillows was no excuse" as the front desk clerks could have left the desk and gotten more pillows. To try to make amends for our atrocious first night, the manager threw in an extra cleaning and changing of sheets. We went out for the day and came back to 6 pillows and a cleaning which included a large frying pan and also dishwasher soap. We also had to call down a few days later after housekeeping had cleaned the unit that day for more toilet paper as both bathrooms were almost out and there weren't any other rolls left. Also, the website said this was a "Mike Ditka Resort" and we found out from the manager that only 4 units in the whole resort were managed by his company. And that the new management company took the resort over in August of 2008...so this resort is using false advertising to gain customers. My husband and I have owned in two timeshares for the past ten years and have never had as bad experience as this one...definitely will not be back nor will we recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: NaplesRI
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Lighthouse Key Resort last summer. We had some concerns reading reviews here, but saw enough positives that nothing else lured us away. We were disappointed to be given a 1st floor unit, and told no other was available. We had 2 other disappointments which I will talk about later in this review. Overall, we were all extremely happy we chose to stay here! The pictures you see are true to what the place looks like. The pool area is spacious, and the little store is cute and has some limited food. The game room overlooks the pool area and is a good idea for rainy days. We found the location to be easy access to Disney (thanks to a shortcut we found on a Disney website). Being right next to Orange Lake Country Club makes it very easy to find first time in. We don't mind the busy 192 area that someone else complained about, because our shortcut made travel to the park easy. You are very close to Animal Kingdom at this location. The staff was great. From check in to everyone we ran into, they were all friendly and accomodating. Special note- the woman at the gate was just so friendly and always so happy, it was a delight to drive in and see her there. The accomodations were lovely, and extremely spacious. As an extended family traveling with 5 adults and a 6 yr old, we appreciated all the space we had here. The kitchen was well stocked with pots, pans, utensils, though as a previous poster noted, there are no teflon type pans. Also there were no dish towels, so do bring a couple of your own. We were lucky, being Florida residents we drove and could bring whatever we felt we needed. There is a Publix very close by, and a short distance away there is a Walmart on Rt 27 that we went to, it wasn't far. If you stay more than 4 days you are given a mid week "refresh" of linens, towels, papergoods, but we passed on that. We'd rather have no strangers in our room and make our own beds. :) (no daily maid service, though I think you can request for additional charge) We did get one call to go to a time share presentation at 8:30am to save $100 off bill, but we passed- simply no time with our Disney visits. No pressure whatsoever. Our two issues: 1) No bedspreads on the twin beds. It made the room look "unfinished" and just not right. When we asked we were told they did not have any to put on. Upon checkout, we spoke to the manager about this and he indicated they are going to be moving to the look many hotels have- fresh white linens on the bed, no spread, just a mini spread (sorry I dont know what they are called though I have seen them) at the bottom of the bed. That's great- but when you have someone walk into their bedroom for the first time, it is a disappointment as it is. (side note- most of the units have trundle beds in the 3rd bedroom so be sure to request the units with twin beds if you have an adult or are concerned about trundles.) 2) Wi-fi. Access was ridiculous. You MIGHT get in, but could never stay in. They give you a number to call for problems, and you stay on hold for 30 mins with no one coming on.. We made calls on 3 different days and finally gave up in frustration. The manager did say that they are thinking of getting some wires so people could connect hard wired if they have issues, but that didn't help on this visit when 2 of our party needed access for work. The only other somewhat negative comment is that the living room seating is for 5 people. A 3 bedroom unit should have enough seating for everyone. (6 at least) Since we were mostly at the parks it wasn't as important this time, but a return trip would hopefully include more relaxation time Our issues did cause some frustration, but overall were small issues when you look at the big picture. No place is perfect, and these issues don't make us feel negatively about Lighthouse Key at all. We would definitely recommend to a friend and we would go back there again, depending on price and what was available.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home in Florida”
Reviews.Author: cashworth1984
Reviews.Content: As a hotelier I understand how hotels work, kinda takes away from going to different hotels. When we pulled up into the parking lot I was floored. This property is gorgeous! The two story lobby has an amazing fitness center, MOVIE THEATER, game room, business center, outdoor bar, deli, and pool. The staff was very friendly and competent. The condos were large and very plush. We had 6 people staying in the condo, and we had plenty of room. I actually had to sleep on the fold out sofa, but the bedding was very nice, so you can imagine how nice the actual beds are. I would reccomend this hotel to any and every one!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel_fan1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two 20+something children and their 20+something significant others for a week's vacation in Orlando. We needed a 4-5 bedroom condo and our travel consultant recommended Lighthouse Key. We had been staying at Windsor Hills the past two times we visited the Orlando area, but we needed more room. The 4 bedroom condo was wonderful. The rooms were very spacious and the beds were very comfortable. There are flat-screen tvs in every bedroom and a very large one in the living room. The 2 main bathrooms are quite large, with separate areas for toilet/shower/bath/sink and the third bathroom was compact (in comparison) but was fine. The front desk staff was very friendly and quite accommodating to several special requests we made. The bar and deli staff were also quite friendly, and the deli guy (from NY) makes THE BEST deli sandwiches we have ever tasted...at very affordable prices. We ate two nights at the deli, poolside, and it was quite pleasant. The units all have wifi...which worked perfectly while we were there. Recommendations to management: These were fairly minor details, but things that could easily be "fixed" to make the units even better. 1. There is one small trash can in the kitchen and a miniscule one in each of the three bathrooms in the "toilet" room. PLEASE add some trashcans to the bedrooms!! 2. The living room has a nice size sleeper sofa and two simple chairs. There is plenty of room, and we would have really liked, to also have a loveseat or an additional small sofa in the living room. The chairs are just not that comfortable. 3. There were a couple of lamps in every room, but I think they all had 25 watt bulbs in them. We purchased higher-wattage bulbs for the stay, and it would be nice if you used the higher-wattage bulbs in all the lamps and overhead lights. Again, these are relatively minor issues. We would highly recommend Lighthouse Key.

Reviews.Title: “We Miss the Lighthouse Key Already!”
Reviews.Author: Wewillgofar
Reviews.Content: We've just returned to Canada after spending 8 wonderful sun-filled days in Florida. The Lighthouse Key Resort was absolutely beautiful. Our 3 bedroom condo was HUGE, complete with 3 bathrooms, 2 large master bedrooms with walk-in closets and jacuzzi tubs and a bedroom with 2 single beds for the kids. Our view was fantastic as we could watch the sunrise each morning over Orange Lake and its resort. Most nights we watched the fireworks (from our balcony) at Magic Kingdom and Epcot (and over the entire week, we witnessed the hatching of 2 baby cranes below us, along the shoreline). The heated outdoor pool and hot tub were great, but the kids especially enjoyed the arcade, the movie theatre, and billiard room. Because we had booked through a time share company (and had agreed to do a 90 minute time share tour), our rate was half price! The tour was not at the Lighthouse Key however, so the place we toured looked like a dump compared to the Lighthouse. We were very impressed with the layout of the rooms, the decor, the 4 tvs and the use of an XBox for the week. The pool deli shop rents the games for $5, so the kids enjoyed that. The resort was very clean, with well manicured lawns and friendly staff. Mid week, our room was cleaned and tidied, with fresh towels, soaps (and our dishes were washed too). Very close are grocery stores like Target and WalMart, and the roadways are very well marked and attractions are very easy to get to. Lighthouse Key Resort will be a tough act to follow! One final note, the resort has 2 buildings so far, with a total of about 80 units. A model of the resort is found on the second floor above the lobby, which shows that the resort has grand plans to continue into the next phase of development, with several more buildings planned for sometime in the future. With a few more activities (pool side entertainment, shuffle boards, perhaps a beach some day), this resort will certainly rival the Orange Lake resort next door.

Reviews.Title: “First Vacation”
Reviews.Author: djaita
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Orlando for the first time with our kids, and looked around for some nice resorts. we came across the lighthouse Key, and imediatly fell in love. we arrived at the resort after a long drive from Toronto, Canada and cheked in, they upgraded us from a 2 bedroom to a 3 bedroom for free because our room was not yet ready. we were unsure about staying on the first floor, when we entered our room, we were so pleased!!! we LOVED IT. I would Recommend this to ALL OF MY FRIENDS and FAMILY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: mirdm
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend stay at Lighthouse Key. We live in South Florida so we are in Orlando often and always looking for good places to stay. We traveled with our 6-month old, my parents, and my sister and brother. We got a 3 bedroom, 3 bath "condo" that was GORGEOUS! and equipped with everything you could want and more. The room was clean and nicely decorated and very comfortable for 6 adults and an infant! We arranged in advance for a pack and play/portable crib and when we arrived it was set up in one of the bedrooms with a sheet on it. The resort itself is small, two buildings, the lobby/deli/spa building, and a pool area. The pool area is lovely - two pools, one smalller salt-water pool, and a larger family friendly pool. There is also a hot tub. at the pool area there is a deli/ice cream shop and a bar that are relatively reasonably priced. Everyone was very nice and courteous and we had a great stay overall. It seems like it is a bit far from the disney parks BUT they give you directions to take a back way to Disney that avoids ALOT of the traffic. Be advised though, that if you are going west on 192 from the turnpike, it is about 20 miles and from I-4 is about 5 miles. It's a little hard to find the entrance, especially at night but overall it is a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall value”
Reviews.Author: smth50
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that we live in Tampa so this trip was all of an hour or so from our house. For us this is a great, economical location for a long weekend at the Disney parks. It is absolutely more cost-effective than staying on property plus it is a condo so you can put the kids down for an afternoon nap without having to tip-toe around the hotel room. The drive to the various Disney parks took approximately 20 minutes in the off-season. Pros: It was clean and brand new. Easy access to the parks. Absolutely no solicitation regarding the purchase of a timeshare unit. Cons: We rented a two bedroom however the second bedroom had a twin bed with a trundle. Unfortnateley we had assumed that the second bedroom would have two twins that could be pushed together similar to what we experience when we rent a condo at the beach. So keep that this in mind. Also, there are only 2 buildings that have been completed the rest is just flat land where they stopped building. Didn't impact our stay at all but it shows you the impact of the recession. As for the comments in previous posts, we did not see any ants but also would not expect to see ants in Feb. You will notice that those posts were from summer stays which is the rainy season and, thus, probably the cause for the Nearby construction would also stir up ants. As for the comments regarding lack of daily maid service, we initially had concerns about this as well because the condo we rent at the beach has daily maid service. I got over it when we were told by a friend who has a timeshare that the once a week maid service is standard for timeshares. Oh well. We were there for 3 days so we simply put the towels in the washer and dryer. The facility does provide a single use supply of TIde (and diswasher detergent as well). If we were to come again, for longer than a weekend, I would bring detergent from home (or buy at a local grocery store). We weren't able to access the wireless internet but also didn't try contacting the phone number given to us at check-in if we were to have trouble connecting. The cable channel line-up is limited. They assume that since you are on vacation that you won't need your monday morning dose of CNBC or Bloomberg. We didn't try the spa but I have heard from others here locally that it is very nice. Overall, we would stay again and recommend to others as it really met all of our needs. Once we get past the need for naps we might consider staying on property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: BellaxSwan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the lighthouse key resort over the Christmas/New years holiday 2008. I can honestly say this is by far the best place we have stayed in Orlando (we've been about 10 times). The condo was perfect, everything spotless, lovely furniture t.v's ect. The kitchen was very well equipped and again spotless. We had a nice view from the balcony across a beautiful lake. the swimming pool area was lovely, clean and spacious. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Towels, sheets ect. were reguarly changed and they even put our dishes in the dishwasher and washed them for us! The location was brilliant, in the distance would could even see the Animal Kingdom resort and terror tower! If you're planning on taking a family holiday then I would recomend this resort, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lighthouse Key Resort & Spa - Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Family_Vacationer1
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel through tripadvisor.com, booked through venere.com based on tripadvisor.com's search for hotels function. Our purpose was to stay 5 nights while visiting Disney World, and another night due unforeseen airport issues that arose at an airport hotel. Everything at the Lighthouse Key Resort and Spa was fabulous. There were seven in our party. Service was great. They were prompt and answered our needs whenever we called. The address is 8545 Irlo Bronson Way. They aren't the ones that have the Mike Ditka website. I believe perhaps Mike Ditka's is the same condo location - but it's contracted out to a different service office - perhaps some of the units are owned and serviced by Mike Ditka's and some are owned directly by Lighthouse Key Resort and Spa. The service - we confirmed, is on-site where we stayed. The three bedroom Grandview was spacious, we had two ECVs that were needed but did not require a handicap room. And there was still plenty of room for our party. We saved hundreds of dollars by shopping at the local grocery, and still were able to eat out for signature dining events special events at Disney. We rented two cars from Kissimee. Once you know where you're going, getting there is truly a breeze. Traffic really isn't all that bad, and we went at peak holiday season. There were no problems getting into the park - unlike the rumors they didn't close once on us. Tip - get to the park early at opening or pre-opening if possible, and use the FastPass. Also, www.touringplans.com or one of the other tour guide plans, e.g., www.tourguidemike.com that you can find on the websites can help to plan out the best times to go to which rides and to prioritize ones that suit your needs is essential. Mousesavers.com was also helpful, and Disboards.com too. Can't say enough about the place, it's gorgeous, clean, saved $, did own laundry for free (there is a washer and dryer in the 3-bedroom condo unit). Also note - the service for cleaning/towels is on the 4th day or so. We'd read some of the reviews so we bought a roll of paper towels and 4 rolls of toilet paper to prepare. I also had bought a box of tissues mid-week just in case. We bought our own powder laundry detergent and powder dishwasher detergent. There is a one-time use only powder detergent that comes with the unit until you can go out for more. Honestly, for the seven people, there isn't really a comparison to on-site in terms of the space, value, and luxury of the place. We played billiards the first night we got there for a few minutes, and we used the two master suites and whirlpool tubs and showers. The decor is really wonderful. Wish we had time to go in the pool, whirlpool, but were really at DIsney. We did ask for toilet paper on the day they cleaned because there wasn't a refill in one of the 3 bathrooms, and they were accommodating right away. We read about the ants review and kept everything clean - it is the South so there will be more ants there - we didn't have problems keeping everything clean (rinse then dishwasher the dishes, don't leave out the maple syrup on the counter). Once after having orange juice, waffles, toast and eggs for breakfast we did see four ants near the sink/syrup when we returned - but some of the maple syrup had been on the counter, which is understandable. After that there was nothing. The trash, you can take out daily there was a common trash disposal area nearby outside in the hallway, we made sure that if we left trash in the trashcan in the kitchen for the day it was tied so it wouldn't be open food, but we pretty much just took it out daily (down the hall outside) and there were no problems at all. We did get a call about the timeshare, but we said no and were left alone. On the balcony of one of our suites we were able to see the Epcot fireworks our first night in, which was cool. After that we spent much of our time at the parks. From my point of view and the description in the AAA tourbook, this is a Condo rental, so you would expect it to be like a condo rather than a hotel, but there is on-site personnel there, so it's better than what we might expect. We found the resort to be an excellent value for the level of accommodations. We had a fantastic vacation and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull service”
Reviews.Author: Chivslima
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the instalations were nice, but the service was a total disaster. I never have had such a bad service. And here are the reasons: One day they didnt clean the room, and when we call to complain about this they said that no housekeeping were available... and they could do nothing about that. Then the keys were "disconnected" 3 days, and they took almost and hour to bring new keys so we can enter our villa. Another thing is that they have charged us one extra night, that we paid when we made the reservation. Now, we have called the hotel to complain about this and instead of solving the problem they just make us leave messagges in an answering machine. So, if you go to this hotel you have to be aware of the awful service you are going to recieve. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “As happy as I was last year!”
Reviews.Author: JMC410
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this property a year ago when it first opened in a three bedroom unit. At that time I felt that it was the nicest place that I had ever stayed at. This year I upgraded to a four-bedroom unit (#2408) and I was equally impressed. I did not encounter any of the ant problems mentioned in earlier posts, and the staff could not have been nicer or more accomodating. We had one unit "cleaning" during our one week stay, and in between this time we simply behaved as we would have if at home... pick up after yourself! The food at the deli by the pool was also very good. I have recommended Lighthouse Key to everyone I know that has traveled to Orlando, and I will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Lighthouse key resort and spa”
Reviews.Author: Kick_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lighthouse key resort last month. We had booked the condo about 9 months earlier. A month before we were to arrive we were contacted by two different management companies both telling us to check in with them. One was onsite and one was not. I guess some rooms are owned by one company now and some of the others are managed on site. It was very confusing, but we ended up checking in on site. We didn't have any problems with check in. Our room was a 3 bedroom, 3 bath condo overlooking the lake. It was fabulous! We had 2 adults and 4 children and had plenty of room. There were two king beds with huge master bathrooms and one smaller bedroom with two beds and a small bathroom. There are huge walk in closets, 4 tvs and a very well stocked kitchen. It was very clean and also had a great laundry room, and deck. I can not say enough about what a great value this place is. The pool and grounds are also nice. There is a security gate that is manned at most times. (one time we came home and it was empty) The location is very convenient to Disney world and a local grocery store and Walgreens. There is a new super target also being built very close. There is also wireless internet in the rooms and a very nice business center complete with computer access and printers. I would highly recommend this place to stay. If we go back we will definitely stay here again. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: smjr1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May while visiting Disney. The condos were very nice and clean. We had 7 people so we stayed in the 4 bedroom condo. It was plenty big enough. The kitchen was very nice with all major appliances. The pool area was nice, but not the best. They provide pool towels so you do not have to bring your own. There were not a lot of resturants right near by. It was about 15 minutes away from Disney. We had to ask for extra towels on most days, but they always gave them to us. There is no full maid service other then towel switching and garbage. There was a vacuum in the room. Overall, it was a very nice stay and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “second visit”
Reviews.Author: TexasToilet
Reviews.Content: this is our second stay this year. New mgmt disappointing,get go staff told us economy problems caused shortage in staff,so no daily room cleaning or clean towels. Told we had to wash our own. We would not book here again, as mgmt is rude and sloppy to guests. You almost have to beg for towels or to have a bathroom cleaned before mid stay clean. Dirty towels are not sanitary, and we are very disappointed. We thought the deli owner rude, and unsure of the current management also.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but BEWARE OF ANTS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kharr026
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for only one night, the last night of our Honeymoon (the hotel that we had been staying at was unavailable this night). Upon check-in we were very impressed with the property and our room was gorgeous. We had a two bedroom with a full kitchen. The decorating was perfect and very high class, not to mention the beautiful view of the pool that we had from our room. We thought that we had lucked in on a very great hotel! Until the next morning when we woke up, and discovered that there were ants crawling all over our things. It appeared as though they were coming through the sliding doors that granted access to the balcony. We were glad that we were leaving that very morning after this discovery. Upon check-out, we asked the lady at the front desk (Cheryl) if she realized that there was an ant problem at their hotel. She said, "oh yes we know, sorry about that, ants are problematic this time of year, but was the rest of your stay alright?". I couldn't believe how carefree she was about the whole thing. It was almost as if I was telling her that there weren't enough towels. Unbelievable. I think that Lighthouse Key could have a great hotel if they had better customer service and better pest control.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, but needs a deep clean”
Reviews.Author: lcross8412
Reviews.Content: We just completed our week long stay. This is our second time staying at the resort. In all our trip was great, however there are a few things to note. Please note that when you check-in you do at the sister property about 8 miles away. This can be a pain if you need anything from the front desk.....information, final bill, keys, etc. When we reached our room, we were shocked to find furniture out of place and trash throughout the unit. This included chinese food, breakfast sausage, eggs, beer cans, etc. I placed a phone call to the sister property to complain. Somebody arrived at our unit 30 minutes later to inspect. At that point I had already cleaned the unit. He offered an apology and offered to change us to another unit that was clean...but I refused since we had already unpacked. This place is nice, however it is going down quickly due to improper cleaning. My husband and I found so much human hair all over our unit. It was gross. It was on the floors, inside dresser drawers, inside the shower, etc. They are not cleaning these places throughly. Boogers on the picture in the bathroom....yuck, yuck, yuck. The towels were very grungy and need to be replaced. The pillows on the sofa were heavily soiled and need to be washed or replaced. There was a major insect problem....ants everywhere and even spiders. We woke up each morning with bites all over our bodies. Each bathroom is only provided with one roll of toilet paper...so if you have a large party...bring more. No dish soap, dishwasher soap, trash bags, laundry powder, sponge is provided. Light bulbs were burned out as well. We did not get any daily cleaning, however the few times that I bumped into management they did ask if we needed anything. There are no vending machines on site and the Deli was always closed due to "a slow day". There is a front gate with security, however every time we passed through we guards were on break. Big changes need to be made if this place wants to stay alive. First, they can start with a deep cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort teething problems?”
Reviews.Author: bettyboop70
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed when we checked in at Lighthouse Key - however the receptionist did try to charge us an $11 per day resort fee each which was already included in our package - she said she would look into it and fairplay she did. Our 4 bedroom condo was lovely - however the safe had been locked shut and had to call out the engineer who quickly fixed the problem - Our tumble dryer was broken as the start knob was snapped off - yet again the engineer had to come out - he explained that the apartment should have been checked before we had checked in. Each apartment has whirlpool baths (2 in ours) at 3 in the morning the apartment next door decided to use theirs and woke all of us up with the noise of the bath - at half past 3 the noise was unbearable and we phoned reception only to be told that the noise would soon stop the bath must have been cleaning itself - what for 2 hours in total what a load of rubbish - this happened on 2 occasions and stopped when the people next door checked out - there should be a notice in the bathroom that says with courtesy to other guest whirlpool baths should not be used after midnight - ridiculous. We too had an infestestion of ants - all over my sons beds which we dealt with ourselves - in hindsight should have called someone to sort this out too - We would stay there again as the staff were lovely and so was the apartment and it is ideally located for everything, the furnishings are very very nice - apartment spacious - great base.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service Supervisor!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler718
Reviews.Content: I'm a hard working widow and I decided I needed a vacation... I did a tour in this property and I thought it was a beautiful and amazing place for me to escape every now and then with my kids. It has been hard since my husband passed... and every year I make sure I take my kids on a vacation. I was going to purchase the time share but then I recieved the most untasteful response to a question by the counter's supervisor to my sorprise she said she was the only one in charge and that was it! I needed a late check out and she to what she responded absolutely not! with a straight face and most untastefull way. I believe her name was Amina and just like that I thought to my self I would never purchase a time share here and have to deal with this person every year in my vacation. Great property but lack of representation.; -

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place, will go back again”
Reviews.Author: MickeyfanCambridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last two weeks of August and can't wait to go back again. The apartments are like a Tradis (bigger on the inside than they look from the outside) and the resort has much to offer - cinema, games room, bar, deli etc. Not forgetting the pool that we could not get our son out of - even to see Mickey Mouse! We were a little concerned about the housekeeping based on what we had read on this site. However, the day we arrived the resort was taken over by a new managment team and we never had a problem with cleaning or service. In fact, everything we asked for was dealt with immediately from extra towels to more coffee filters. We found the staff friendly and were never pestered about time share. This is a lovely resort very convenient for Disney (10 mins) and somewhere we would recommend and return to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accommodation ,dreadful service”
Reviews.Author: jaxxyHuddersfield
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in the Lighthouse key Resort and Spa in late August 2008. First impressions were very good the quality of the accommodation is very impressive. The villas themselves are roomy and well decorated and initially clean. The facilities are what they said they would be and all to a high standard. I had read a few reviews on this website (after I had already booked- lesson there I think) about problems with housekeeping but as some of you will probably think too , I hoped that people were being over particular.After 3 days of the same towels we went to reception to find out what we could expect from them.They told us towels would be changed every 3 days and I assumed linen after a week.Well I was wrong everything was hit and miss and when I complained was told that I was receiving this quality of service because I booked from England via a website not directly and the only way they could offer such a good deal (believe me it wasn't that good) was to do so by not offering a proper maid sevice.I was told I could get one but would have to pay. I complained and eventually as a gesture they offered to provide linen the following day. Once again a promise they did not deliver upon until we complained again. As I read this sounds like this is all we did but the standard of customer service was atrocious made worse because standards in USA are generally excellent. Anyway to cut a long story short after an infestation of ants (that really didn't seem to faze anyone so I assume must be a common problem)and just when we thought this truly could not get any worse on the last day we had to pay a resort fee that amounted to £50 for the provision of such excellent facilities! (Ithink the ants came free!!) Like other reviewers I think our experience is a real shame as this has the makings of excellent accommodation but this cutting corners approach reflects really badly on the management of this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: tarajaneEssex
Reviews.Content: We spent three weeks at the lighthouse keys resort and spa and i would say it is a great place with everything my family and our holiday required. The accomadation is fantastic with good ample size living space and everything you could need. When we arrived we checked in the staff are very helpfull and informative. The pool is actually smaller than it looks on the web site but it certainly did the job to cool off and relax after a long day at the disney parks! You also had no trouble getting sunbeds as there are plenty and while we were there it never actually got that busy, there were always plenty of clean towels and the pool area is imaculate, there is also a small pool and a small hot tub, the pool area is open till 11pm. There is a small deli (shop) by the pool area which sells all you need if you dont manage or forget something at one of the bigger supermarkets nearby. You can also get drinks for by the pool there if the bar area is not open. The shop rents dvds and x box games at 5$ a night not a great choice but if you want something for an evening in its fine. The resort does state that there are x boxes in all the appartments but when i enquired as to where ours was we were told they have now been taken out of all the rooms because they kept getting pinched! We were given one from the front desk which you can keep till you check out. The bar area is nice and the staff are friendly and they make fantastic smoothies. Both the bar and the deli provide food like sandwiches, salads, paninis, pizza or burgers for a poolside snack they are not cheap but the sandwiches are huge! The resort provides a free newspaper (usa today) delivered every morning, the only negative i had which really was not a big issue was the housekeeping, when we arrived the appartment was spotless but you do not get them everyday (i think it was every three days) and they letterally just make the beds (not change sheets) and clean the bathroom area. But whenever they came to us it was always late afternoon when we were there so i told them not to bother as i dont like it when im there and im sure they only done it at that time to get tips! They do do a service where you can have the beds changed and a full clean including hoovering but they charge and i thought it was expensive for what they do so i made full use of the laundry room myself which was great as i came home from a three week holiday without spending two days washing as i had none. The resort is not far from everything and the trip to most disney parks never took us more than 20 mins. The Wal mart is about 20 mins away aswell but just 2 mins away is a Publix supermarket which sells everything you need and was no more expensive than the bigger chains, there is also a Walgreens pharmacy opposite the resort which again is like a supermarket it sells everything including milk and is open 24hrs. There is a Mcdonalds opposite and a lovely restaurant called Hoolihans which served fantastic food, there is also a pizza hut next door and hundreds of other eateries just minutes away. On the whole i really enjoyed my stay here and would return, i had a pedicure in the spa but did not have the time to try anything else but my experience was nice they were very friendly and profesional, the spa treatments were not cheap but no more expensive than you pay at home and certainly a well needed bit of relaxation time! There is also a gym but i certainly did not have time to use that but it looked well equiped. The apartments are well kept and the air con is a welcome relief there are also ceiling fans in all the rooms for a bit of added extra. The kitchen area has everything you need if you want to stay in and cook. We were really lucky and had a balcony area over looking the lake and every night at 10 (if we were not out) it was lovely to sit out and watch the magic kingdom fireworks with a nice cold glass of wine. All the apartments have wifi connection and both the living room and main bedroom had dvd players, all rooms had lovely big tvs. In the main building on the first floor there is a computer room next to the spa there are two computers both with internet, you need your room card to get in but they are free to use.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Resort”
Reviews.Author: DJT...DJT...DJT
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting resort as it cannot decide if it is providing hotel service or a condo service. We stayed for 12 days in July and house keeping consisted of a change of towels and beds were made up every third day. It was unfortunate that they did not clean the bathroom during this service. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit at ground level and the condo overlooked the parking area. The back of the unit did not have windows so was dull at the back. The second bedroom also contained a roll out bed and this was not comfortable. The furnishing are new but were already showings signs of ware and tare. The high speed internet access is also problematic to connect to if you have the Vista platform on your Laptop. The resort helpline could not resolve the connection problems. We were also invited to attend a breakfast presentation on the benefits of fractional ownership at the resort which we firmly declined. We made it clear that we did not want to attend but were called a further 2 times during our stay and pestered to attend. It is also important to note that a resort fee will add to the booking cost. The resort had plenty of sun beds but when they build more blocks the pool area may be under pressure. We enjoyed our stay at Lighthouse Key and the friendly service from the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation but shame about the housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: WalesCavalier
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a 4 bed condo in July 2008 for 14 nights. We were delighted with the accommodation. The quality of the fixtures and fitting were superb. The condo had three bathrooms, two of which were ensuite with double sinks, shower and spa bath. With a fully equipped kitchen, laundry room and huge LCD TV we could ask for no more. However what lets this accommodation down is the housekeeping. We did not get our room cleaned for the first week and after numerous visits to reception we asked for a full maid service at a cost $70 a day! but we still did not get our room cleaned. After demanding to speak to the manager the room was finally cleaned a couple of days before we were due to leave. We were give clean towels when we requested them but it really was not good enough. The quality of the reception service alse left a lot to be desired (1) because of our numerous requested being undealt with in relation to the room being cleaned and (2) we had to make numerouse requests to ask for an infestation of ants in the corridor outside out room to be dealt with. This is beautiful accommodation and the spa gives it that something extra special but we will not be returning as I fear with their policy on cleaning fixtures and fittings will quickly deteriorate. I hope that these are teething problems and that the management takes contol because they have put a great deal of thought and investment into the Lighthouse Key Resort & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday.. but poor housekeeping lets this resort down”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Lighthouse Key for two weeks in July 2008, our main summer holiday. Been to the Kissimmee area a few times before so had a good idea what to expect. Everything about this 'resort' is great, except for two things ....... The welcome breakfast - forget it. A sales pitch trying to sell timeshare weeks at the resort in return for some vouchers at the deli (excellent filled rolls) and a totally useless and unusable gas voucher. Selling timeshare in the US to a family from the UK !!! Don't they know about the credit crunch and the price of airfares due to the oil price. Maintenance fees were very high. The housekeeping was totally unreliable. They seemed to turn up when it suited. Changed towels every 4 days or so and changed bed linen once in 2 weeks. We ended up helping ourselves to towels from the housekeeping trolley when we returned to the resort after a long day at the parks. Also, the corridors were never swept and would have benefitted from a good scrub. Our balcony was littered with the previous incumbents cigarette ends, and despite reporting this the balcony was never cleaned so remained unused throughout our holiday. That said, the reception staff were pleasant and courteous and, despite giving me keys on arrival to an apartment that was already occupied (much to my displeasure - and that of the room incumbents) did their best to make our stay enjoyable. The accomodation (3 bed appt) was very spacious and well appointed. No complaints. The facilities in the clubhouse are very good - although it was quiet when we were there so not sure if 2 computers in the business suite are adequate when it's busy. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the resort to other families.... just make sure you find out where the housekeeping staff park their trolleys overnight so you can get access to clean towels.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Capazools
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about this hotel. It was absolutely beautiful. Very luxurious!!! I stayed here after a long day at Disney with my 4 sisters and mother. We had a three bedroom condo. It exceeded all of our expetations!!! We were in awe. Very elegantly decorated. Huge condo. Very very clean!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: GRACE1121
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and great place to vacation at. Its good for small or large families or if you are just traveling with friends. Very spacious and comfortable. It has all the modern amenities (such as xbox & dvd player)you look for in a new resort. Front desk was very helpful giving area information. Housekeeping was great as well. Will stay here as again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lighthouse Key Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: amyandbri
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Lighthouse Key Resort and Spa. I can't say enough about this place! I was a little worried about other reviews that I had read about the housekeeping not being the best, but we didn't experience anything bad at all. We had fresh towels everyday, turndown service with chocolates at night. Housekeeping even cleaned the dirty dishes in the sink and ran the dishwasher. In the past, we usually stay on Disney property, but had six in our party this time and needed more space. I didn't miss Disney property at all! I couldn't believe how big our three bedroom was. Plus, it was so quiet. I knew the kids were out in the livingroom playing XBox 360 but I couldn't hear them at all in my bedroom. Great insulation. VERY CLEAN!!!! Anyone can email me for more specifics. We all loved the accomodations and the people were VERY nice. I found a really good video of the 3-bedroom unit we had on youtube. The url is http://youtube.com/watch?v=9INA1Z8QvGQ.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: scmontague5
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort using the free Magicard and were given a great rate for our 4 bedroom Villa. The pictures posted and reviews written to date are very accurate. Our experience was mostly a positive one. For a large family (since Disney tends to accommodate families of 4) it was really nice to have a lot of room to move around, everyone had a bed to sleep in, and the kitchen/laundry were really handy! We ate breakfast in our villa every morning...saving a few dollars. The staff were helpful, however, it did take some time for them to respond to our requests (extra pillows, towels, maintenance, etc.) amounting in several reminders. All in all, I would highly recommend the Lighthouse. It is conveniently located to just about everything, especially the Disney parks. Traffic could be heavy but we were early birds and left the Villa around 8 a.m. every morning resulting in very little traffic. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Jilllipper
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this resort. We stayed here for 4 days at the end of April. We had a fantastic time. The property is beautiful. We were accidentally upgraded to a 4 bedroom 3 bath suite. It was huge! Obviously I was concerned that they were going to charge me more. However, they did not. They honored my original booking price but bumped us up into a double the size suite. We did not take advantage of the cleaning service. I noticed other reviews complaining about it. Unfortunately, I cannot speak from experience. The pool is huge and clean. The zero depth is awesome for young children. I would highly recommended this resort. We will definately look to come back.

Reviews.Title: “The Lighthouse Key resort was outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ciskey
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in a 2BR at the Lighthouse Key Resort and loved it. The appartment was fabulous and very spacious for the 4of us. We were lovely welcomed by the reception staff and I just want to thank Mrs Kara Torres again for her assistance before and during our stay. Got 2 phonecalls regarding Timeshare but after telling we're not interested were never bothered again. Houskeeping did a great job at our appartment. Every day they replenish coffee, towels and even did our dishes! Our jacuzzi didn't work and 1 lamp was broken. They fixed in immediately! This is a wonderfull place, nice swimming pool and at a great location. A short drive to the parks and at a more quiet location. If we should visit this area again I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this propertie again. Though I should check first to discover if there are any building activities b/c they plan to build a lot more towers at the Lighthouse Key.

Reviews.Title: “loved lighthouse key”
Reviews.Author: EvieCee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week and wished we had longer. This is a lovely resort. We had a 3 bed 3 bath and the suite was huge. It is very well laid out with master bedrooms on opposite side of each other. It was nice to have lovely carpeted floor. The bathrooms are beautiful and the beds very comfortable. We asked for more towels and they were brought up straight away. The pool area is smaller than it looked on the pictures but there are plenty of comfy loungers and towels to help yourself to. We did get a few phone calls about the "breakfast" but we just refused and she got the message after that. I wish we had used the facilities more but with so much else to do its difficult. We could see the fire works from disney from our balcony which was great to see. We had a lovely view overlooking the lake. I would definitely stay here again and you get 15% discount from the hotel itself for your next stay, will be checking that out for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pushy, Pushy, Pushy!”
Reviews.Author: teamom01
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at this hotel based on great reviews on Trip Advisor. When we arrived, they could not find our reservation. Although I had the printed copy of the reservation, which they acknowledged was from their website, they were very reluctant to give us a room. No apology was ever given, although the young man stated that he "wouldn't put us out on the street" but would get us a room for the night, but there was no guarantee of a room for the rest of our stay. How kind. The moment we walked in the "concierge" (aka "real estate agent") kept engaging our kids in conversation and tried to reel us in while we were attempting to get our reservation straightened out. Needless to say, we weren't in the mood for the sales pitch. We recieved 3 separate phone calls asking us to come to their breakfast (sales pitch) even though we had told them the first time we weren't interested. The rooms are beautiful but poorly stocked--lightbulb in shower was out and never replaced although we left a note asking for it to be. No replenishing of coffee, dishsoap when out. Computers not working in business office. Overall, a beautiful facility but we'd never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: daphj1003
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. We stayed here March 30-April 4, 2008. When we checked in our room wasn't ready so they upgraded us to a 4 bedroom for a 3 bedroom price. The staff was so nice and helpful. The business computers weren't available so the staff allowed us to check email on their computer. The pool was clean and towels always available. The rooms were very spacious and nice. Loved the tub!!! Also very quiet, especially for spring break. Will definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, hard sell”
Reviews.Author: conandbob
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at the resort, very large, spacious well equipped condo type suites. We booked a 4 bedroom apt, and it fit 9 people very comfortably. Housekeeping does seem to have some issues as we never had enough towels, even if we requested them. Easy enough to walk over to the pool to pick some up, but still....Dishwasher and laundry in the suite was a bonus, not having even salt in the salt shaker was not. The kitchens are completely devoid of any food substances. Who empties a salt shaker?!?! No dishwasher detergent, scrubbie, etc, so stock up at the grocery store about 1/2 mile away. Apart from the strange sterilization of the kitchen, a really nice stay. They are also trying to sell these as time shares, hence the hard sell... Just a morning of your time for discounted Disney tickets, they don't call these sessions pressure cookers for nuthin! Have a nice stay, run away from the "information sessions ".

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Groups!”
Reviews.Author: inomaha
Reviews.Content: We have been planning a trip to Orlando for a year with another family and had researched several resorts around Disney World. In the end, we chose Lighthouse Key because of amenities and price. Although this resort does not have a water park, it had everything else at a great price. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. We got a three bedroom that slept eight - if you include the pullout bed in the couch. Pefect for our two families (three adults and four children). The floor plan allowed us to spread out - with much more space than we have ever experienced at any of the Disney resorts. The bedrooms are located in the corners, with a huge living/dining area and modern kitchen. The two larger bedrooms are both master bedrooms with HUGE bathrooms and closets. The third bedroom is smaller - with just enough room for a trundle bed and a TV. The bathroom for this bedroom is located just outside in the hall. A Publix grocery store was about a mile away. We stopped the first day we arrived and loaded up on groceries. The well-stocked kitchen (pots, pans, dishes) allowed us to cook many meals, saving us hundreds and allowing us to eat much healthier than if we had eaten the standard hamburger-and-chicken-strips fare that's the staple of all Disney parks. Our 8,7, 6 and 5-year-old children loved the fact that we could swim in two pools, play in the arcade, borrow an X-Box (free - although they did put a holding charge on our credit card until we returned the system), and rent movies and games. They only cleaned the room twice in five-and-a-half days, but this was plenty for us. We were able to wash all our clothes with the washer/dryer in our condo on the last day, so everything was clean upon our return home. The deli at the resort serves great food (get the birthday cake ice cream) and the bar at the pool makes for a great way to unwind at the end of a busy day at the parks. Be prepared for the $35/day resort fee charge on top of your room rate - this seems standard in resorts in Orlando. Also, they did try to contact us for a sales pitch on a time share. But since we were out at the parks so much, they only were able to reach us once. We avoided other attempts simply by not answering our "house" phone.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - What a great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: chinamum
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last week for 2 nights with our family. We have 6 children aged from 12 to 4 and we all had a great time. We had a 3 bedroom villa and had plenty of room. We were so pleasantly surprized when we opened the door and saw what awaited us. Huge place, comfy beds, 3 bathrooms, great balcony facing the man made lake...close to everything and just A+. The only issue we had also was that they didn't clean our room at all. We came home to unmade beds and the same towels etc. I didn't even mention it as we were only there for a short time. Anyways..we would definitely stay there the next time. For the price we felt like we were home. Very comfortable and great for a family of our size. Karen & James & family

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: peoplephotographer
Reviews.Content: We booked the resort on Expedia for a really GREAT rate! We booked the two bedroom unit but were upgraded to the 3 bedroom on arrival. It was more then a lot of space for me and my husband, but a nice surprise. Location of the resort is great and not that far to disneyworld, shopping, restaurants, etc. Every evening we went for a dip in the hot tub and pool - it was fabulous. I would highly recommend this resort to anybody going here. The suites were gorgeous. It was great having laundry and a kitchen. We bought a few groceries (only 2 minutes up the road) and ate breakfast every morning in the suite. Book this hotel - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping issues, but would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Baldwingirl
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property and we were very pleased with our two-bedroom suite. It was spacious and nicely decorated and I really appreciated the extra soft towels -seriously, the softest towels I have ever experienced in a hotel and I've stayed in some of the best. However, the housekeeping was definitely below par. One evening, we came home after a long day at the parks to find the Do Not Disturb sign had been placed on our door and we didn't put it there! Upon entering, we were dismayed to see that our room had not been cleaned. We complained and said that we needed new towels and after returning from dinner, found that they had made our beds but removed ALL the towels and didn't replace them. These were not our only housekeeping problems, but we liked the place enough and were happy with the value that we would definitely stay again. When we checked out, the desk agent seemed to have heard many housekeeping complaints and gave us a refund of the $11 per day "resort fee," which we appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better for the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: ajr1977
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Lighthouse Key Resort. Simply couldn't find a fault with the place. We were upgraded to a 3 bedroom upon arrival. The condo was immaculate, flat screen tvs, granite counter tops, what more could you ask for.? The unit was cleaned everyday and fresh towels etc were provided. We ate lunch on the balconey every day and used the gym and spa facilities which were excellent. The condo had everything you could possibly need. The service was excellent, staff were friendly... Wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in Orlando... This place is simply exactly as advertised... Or perhaps better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JLEPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Wow, this was a great stay a fantastic place to stay! We stayed here for five nights in a 4 bedroom suite. It was absolutely beautiful and huge! There were seven of us, two families which included 3 teens and four adults and there was so much room. If you think the pictures look good you should see it in person! I cannot say enough about the stay. The two master bedrooms were beautiful with huge, huge bathrooms and fluffy big towels. The Queen bedroom had plenty of room and the fourth had an Xbox 360! There were five TV's! They turned down the beds, had the TV's on, closed the drapes and left lights on, when we came in at night it felt like we were home. The pool area was beautiful, the bar and food at the pool were both excellent as was the service. The couple that operate the pool and bar were very nice and my strawberry margarita was delivered to me poolside, I thought I was in heaven for a moment or two. Check in was a snap, as was check out and Tabitha and Kara were very helpful with any questions or problems. We had some straightening out to do with billing since we booked through Orbitz and had two families with two separate reservations and Tabitha and Kara were the ones to figure it out for us so we didn't have to change suites. If I had to pick I would say that the 4th bedroom is listed both on Orbitz and on the hotel website as "twin" set up but is really a trundle bed and when you pull it out it's separate. It leaves absolutely no room to walk in the room. We thought it would be twin beds. The only other thing we weren't crazy about was the traffic on the road the hotel was on, it was pretty heavy. We've always stayed on Disney property and didn't deal with traffic but after 20 years of doing that this year the prices went through the roof with Disney for one small room for each family so we decided we needed to change our plan. Staying off sight was great and we enjoyed the non-Disney atmosphere, it was pure luxury staying here! Very easy to get to Disney, Universal, Downtown Disney etc. from the hotel and we would all highly reccommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “LOTS of space, very nice amenities!!!”
Reviews.Author: mk4u
Reviews.Content: The Lighthouse Key Resort is a great place! I found it online and booked directly through their website for the best rate. We booked a 2 bedroom but were upgraded to a 3-bedroom (though we didn't need it as we only had myself, my husband and our 4 year old daughter). The kids room is small, but it has a trundle bed and my daughter loved having her own TV. There is a Nintendo 360 (I think that is what it is called!) in this room and it has it's own bathroom. The kitchen is well appointed w/ everything you could want. The 2 other bedrooms have large bathrooms attached w/ a jetted tub in each and a shower stall & double vanity. The beds are king-sized in each. The living room is rather "proper" not so comfy for watching the super-huge plasma/lcd tv, but it was ok for when we used it. The balcony was very nice, we had a view all the way to the Disney parks and we could see the fireworks (we were on the top -- 5th -- floor). During the day you can see the "triangle" of the Dolphin hotel, the "Everest" ride & the top of the "Tree of Life" at the Animal Kingdom. There were a few draw backs to staying here... it is very new and I think our unit was "underused" I know that is a weird complaint for a hotel but there it is. There were cobwebs in the track lighting over the bar, many lights were not working, there was a coffeemaker but no pot so we just drank instant coffee, and my jetted tub did not work--bummer! Just a few minor inconveniences, otherwise we were very pleased with the service, every staff member greeted you with a "Hello" and a smile, even if just passing in the hallway. The pool area is fabulous, nice workout center, an arcade for kids (and husbands & wives!!), and a movie theater showing new-to-dvd movies, I think "Ratatouilee" was playing one of the days we were there. The security gate made us feel super-safe as there was always sirens at least once a day, being from Maine we don't hear that very often and it was reassuring. All in all a great place to stay--one last bit--this is a "fractional ownership" property--where you buy more time than a timeshare but no one ever bothered us with a sales pitch or a call to attend a seminar or anything. There is printed info to read about but nothing to turn you off to the property.

HotelInfo.Name: Lighthouse Key Resort and Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 8545 W Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy, Kissimmee, FL 34747
